results.description:
REGISTER TO VOLUNTEER

Date: The first Sunday in May

Duration of shift: 5-12 hours, depending on role

Location: New York City – all five boroughs

Age Restriction: Volunteers must be 16 or older on the day of the Tour.

Registration: All volunteers must register in advance of the Tour.

Perks: Complimentary breakfast and/or lunch, commemorative T-shirt, opportunity to register for next year’s Tour before public registration opens, 50% off the registration fee for the Discover Hudson Valley or Twin Lights Ride, a chance to win tons of great prizes, and the satisfaction of knowing you played an integral role in making the world’s biggest charitable bike ride the world’s best bike ride.

results.description:
32,000 riders and 40 miles of car-free streets in all five boroughs of NYC from your bike seat! Stop and catch your breath at fully stocked rest areas, pause for rock, gospel, reggae, etc. musical performances in one neighborhood after another, and relish the camaraderie of fellow cyclists from all over the world and every state in the nation. No better way to experience a day outdoors in New York. "There's a reason why the Tour is considered a bucket list event, and why so many come back year after year." America's largest charitable bike ride, benefitting bike programs.

Registration begins January 12 at 10 a.m. and fills up within a few days to a week depending on the year.

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,


    After an eventful race in China, F1 heads to Sochi Autodrom for the third annual Russian Grand Prix. Winding along the immediate outskirts of the Olympic Village that anchored the 2014 Winter Olympics, the 5.848 km track is a medium-speed circuit with a variety of different corners, including a left-hander inspired by the famous long triple apex Turn 8 at Istanbul Park. The track features 12 right and six left-hand corners, with a 650-meter straight between the first and second turns, on which the cars reach a top speed of around 200 mph.

STANDINGS - After a dominant win at Suzuka, Nico Rosberg now leads in the Drivers' Championship by 36 points. The standings are: Rosberg on top with 75 points, Lewis Hamilton in second with 39 points and Daniel Ricciardo in third with 36 points. In the Constructors' Championship, Mercedes leads with 114 points, Ferrari is in second with 61 points, and Red Bull in third with 57 points.


TIRE ALLOCATION -  For the fourth successive race Pirelli are making their medium, soft and supersoft compound tyres available. Mercedes have selected one set of mediums, four sets of softs and eight sets of supersofts, which is in stark contrast to Ferrari, who have two fewer sets of supersofts and two further sets of softs. Red Bull, meanwhile, have opted for an aggressive approach and picked only one set of mediums, alongside two sets of softs and 10 sets of supersofts for the semi-permanent Sochi track - the same selection as Haas.

Can Nico extend his unbeaten winning streak with another win in Sochi? Can Lewis bounce back after an unlucky race in China to claim his first win of the season? With the upgraded engine Ferrari bringing for Russia, can they claim the first race win of the 2016 season?

If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Russian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 8:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 7:30AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.


We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2016 Russian Grand Prix

results.description:
(This is a pledge event. You will be expected to raise money for a cause - Scott)

Have you ever dreamed of blazing through all five boros in a few short hours, cheered on by adoring crowds…then realized that you were not quite up to running the New York City marathon? If so, we have the event for you.

Join Team WITNESS in the 2016 TD Five Boro Bike Tour - http://www.bike.nyc/events/td-five-boro-bike-tour/ - and bike for human rights worldwide!

On Sunday, May 1st (time TBD), ten bikers sporting fabulous orange jerseys will represent Team WITNESS…and you could be one of them. Each of our fierce and fashionable bikers will commit to raising $1,000 in support of WITNESS’ programs – ensuring that human rights defenders around the world can use their cell phones to film abuse and fight for justice.

As a member of Team WITNESS, you will receive:

Free, guaranteed registration;
Breakfast and lunch on the day of the event;
A personalized jersey;
Fundraising support;
Invitations to special events;
And more!

Last year’s team raised over $12,000 in support of WITNESS’ programs and had a blast doing it! Our team was led by a mother-son duo of Irish invaders, and bolstered by our own Executive Director. We challenge you to surpass their fundraising total and join us in the fight for justice and equality.

Interested in joining Team WITNESS?

Step 1: Contact [masked] to secure your spot and register with the team. The sooner you reach out, the better your chances – we already have a few bikers committed to joining the team, and spots will go quickly! Registration opens January 12 and closes on Friday, April 8.

Step 2: Set up your personalized page on Crowdrise, and use WITNESS’ tips to start fundraising.

Step 3: Ask your family, friends, and colleagues to help you meet your fundraising goal of $1,000 by May 30. If you can think of 25 people who will give you $20, you’re already halfway there! And remember, you’re not on your own – you will have support, encouragement, and excellent fundraising ideas (seriously, we’re full of them! #humblebrag) from Team WITNESS.

Step 4: Bike in the Tour on May 1.
results.name: Bike with WITNESS in the 2016 TD Five Boro Bike Tour!

Game style and Rules:

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

If you have questions about the project, write to Jace at [masked].


See you soon!

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
If you are a developer or data scientist in New York City interested in leveling up your current time-series and InfluxDB knowledge, this all-day training co-presented by InfluxData and Byte Academy is for you!

(To officially register you must purchase tickets here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/influxdb-time-series-data-training-new-york-city-may-1-2016-tickets-22665848162)

Instruction Schedule

* 8:30 - Registration & Coffee
* 9:00 - 12:00 - Instruction
* 12:00 - 1:00 - Lunch
* 1:00 - 5:00 - Instruction

Topics Covered

* Migrating to 0.11 from 0.8, 0.9 or 0.10 with InfluxData Founder and CTO, Paul Dix
* Getting Started with Time-Series Data, the TICK stack and InfluxDB Fundamentals
* Mastering the InfluxDB CLI and Configuration Options
* Understanding Continuous Queries and Retention Policies
* Performance Tuning and Schema Design
* High Availability & Cluster Administration
* Intro to the Telegraf Collector and an Overview of the Plugin Ecosystem
* Backup and Recovery Best Practices

Cost for the class is $299 with a handful of early-bird tickets priced at $249. RSVP and get tickets on our Eventbrite page.

Lunch, coffee, snacks and swag will be provided with breaks taken periodically as the class and instructor feel is necessary.

No refunds.

Questions about the event? Drop us a line at: [masked]

About Byte Academy:  Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco(twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

results.description:
Join us for a Raptor photography. Trained staff at The Cedar Run Wildlife Refuge will bring at least 6 birds out of their enclosures for photographing up-close and personal on perches and in a natural setting. 

****The Refuge charges $50/person for the session, advanced registration and pre-payment are required.****

*****Please Register yourself to reserve a spot******

http://www.cedarrun.org/content/Education/cale.asp?Show=event&evtID=442&month=5

What to carry?

Although bird photography requires special equipment including high shutter speed camera with a telephoto lens but this is a different kind of stuff. 

The staff at the refuge bring birds out in the natural settings and we get an up-close frame of the birds. For this event there is no special equipment required. You just need a camera with capability of focusing to a max distance of 1-2 meters. Most of the times the birds will be within a range of 3-5 feet from camera. 

This Bald eagle was shot from outside of the enclosure mesh, the bird was almost 2-3 meters away with American flag as backdrop. 

Thanks to the Refuge's friendly team to accommodate our request to stage this owl on a branch to serve as if the bird is peeking through the tree. 

An example of the creative minds at the refuge, these guys have a wooden birdhouse with heart shaped window, they staged this little bird to look out of the window.

results.description:
KO is 9 AM Sunday May 1st

Three games to go and Leicester city could achieve what many (especially the bookies) considered a near impossibility at the start of the season.  A win against Man U at Old Trafford would ensure the Premier League trophy would be heading to the King Power stadium. The absence of Vardy didn't seem to derail the LCFC title push with an emphatic 4-0 win over a lackluster Swansea. PFA player of the year Mahrez, Ulloa in for Vardy , Schlupp, Kanté and co turning in another class display, Vardy will be missing again for the Man U clash with the recent ban for  improper conduct being extended one game.

Other than in the FA cup Man U have once again under achieved this season. A win desperately needed if LVG's men are to seriously stake a claim for the  4th spot for Champions league football next season.  LCFC can be sure that a torrid atmosphere awaits them (well you'd think so at least) as they attempt to claim a historic first ever top flight title at the home of the 13 time EPL and 20 all-time title winners. 

Our friend's the Becker brothers founders of the NY Foxes will be there. They've achieved near celebrity status this season themselves with Jason & Jordan between them making appearances in numerous newspaper, magazine and radio interviews the media interest in Leicester's story growing steadily as the reality that LCFC could do it sinks in.  

Whatever team you are rooting for come and join us to witness what could be an epic day in EPL history.

Hello Urban Professionals,

Right now, babies need all the help they can get. Premature birth affects about 450,000 babies here in the United States. I’m walking in March for Babies to get the message out about this terrible problem and you can help. I'm also walking in honor of my twins that were born premature. They are my little heroes and in honor of them and every other child that was born premature I ask you to donate to this worthy cause and come walk with us to make a difference for these little angels. Please make a secure donation to help me reach our goal.

Help fight premature birth.

Premature birth is the #1 killer of babies. When you March for Babies, you join us to:


- help moms have healthy pregnancies


- support families in the NICU


- fund research to fight premature birth and birth defects

Together we can help the March of Dimes fight prematurity so more babies can get the strongest start possible.


Funds raised in March for Babies support research and programs that help moms have full-term pregnancies and babies begin healthy lives. And they will be used to bring comfort and information to families with a baby in newborn intensive care.

I thank you in advance for your support and can't wait to see how much we can raise and how many people will come out to support this amazing cause on May 1st at Jones Beach, Parking Field 5, Wantagh, NY 11793!


Your presence and your gift matters...

Find this event on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/events/174270249623761/

results.description:
https://cbsnewyork.files.wordpress.com/2012/05/td-five-boro-bike-tour.jpg?w=1500

On the first Sunday in May, 32,000 cyclists of all skill levels come from around the world to roll through every borough of New York City on streets totally free of traffic. For one day, the roads are yours, the bridges are yours, the City is yours. There’s no better way to experience the Big Apple by bike. Produced in conjunction with the New York City Department of Transportation, the TD Five Boro Bike Tour is the world’s biggest charitable bike ride, with proceeds funding our free bike education programs. Last year alone, we taught bike skills to more than 16,000 kids and adults. When you ride with Bike New York, you’re helping us in our mission to empower more New Yorkers to grab life by the handlebars.


The route begins in Lower Manhattan, heads north via Sixth Avenue through the interior of Central Park and continues into Harlem</a> and Bronx<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bronx"> via the Madison Avenue Bridge. Re-entering Manhattan and traveling south along the East River on the FDR Drive. The route crosses the Queensboro Bridge</a> into Queens before heading south across the Pulaski Bridge into Brooklyn<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooklyn">, over the Broklyn-Queens Expressway via the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verrazano-Narrows_Bridge"></a> into Staten Island.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YWHs1_cRxA0

Active Long Island NEEDS to be riding in this next year.  Who's with me?
results.name: NY 5 Boro Bike Tour

results.description:
The many advantages of aeroponic gardening benefit both the gardener and the environment. The system uses mist to water and oxygenate the roots of whichever vegetables you plant in the vertical columns, such as the popular Tower Gardens. It uses only 10% of the water and nutrients that would otherwise be necessary in traditional ground-level gardening, because everything is recycled. Tests have shown that aeroponic gardening creates 30% more produce, as seen in vegetables that grow both larger and faster, with a higher density of nutrients.

Gardeners have much less work to do with aeroponics. Because the plant roots are inserted into openings in vertical columns, there's no digging, tilling, weeding, or even bending over, which is especially beneficial for seniors. With no soil in the columns, soil-born pests are no longer a problem. Typically, 28 plants can be grown in a space just 2.5 feet in diameter.

This class will be taught by garden group member Laura Lee Winslow. We'll meet in her home to view an informative PowerPoint presentation, and in her garden where we'll examine her Tower Gardens, as shown in these photos. We'll see how these columns are portable, and can be placed wherever they can receive 5 to 6 hours of daylight. They're ideal for those who have very small gardens, or just a deck, patio, lanai or balcony. They can even be positioned indoors by a sunny window, or surrounded by grow lights.

As in most of our group's classes, generous members bring along some light foods and drinks for others to share during the traditional snack-and-chat period. Others bring their excess plants for the free plant-exchange table, and take home other plants for their own gardens. Such features help long-time members meet the many newcomers, and encourage everyone to exchange gardening ideas for this semi-tropical environment.


To learn more about aeroponic gardening with Tower Gardens, click on this green link to see Laura Lee's web page. Note that this class is limited to only 25 people. After that limit is reached, any who later register to attend will automatically be placed on the waiting list. To indicate whether you will or won't attend this class, click on the green RSVP panel near the upper right corner of the screen and click either Yes or No. If you're inviting gardening friends to come along, add to your RSVP response the number who will attend. And if you or they change their plans, be sure to update your RSVP so others who are on the waiting list can take your place. This is the first time a class on aeroponics has been presented at our events, so it's bound to be very popular.
results.how_to_find_us: The un-gated community of Island Park is 2.5 miles west of Tamiami Trail (US 41), then via Park Road and Jacobs Drive to Cocos Drive. Laura Lee's husband John will direct the parking on their driveway, or the driveway across the street.
results.name: Aeroponic vertical gardening: a productive version of hydroponics with no soil

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: This event is sponsored by The New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up groups. YOU MUST PREPAY FOR THIS EVENT USING THE LINK IN THE EVENT DESCRIPTION.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those registered. There will be over 50 people participating.  If you have any questions please contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

MUST PRE-PAY TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT: PREPAY HERE https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudson-valley-spring-hike-wine-tasting-farm-stands-walkway-over-the-hudson-tickets-24816000325

Just and hour and fifteen minutes north of the city, awaits an amazing day filled with beautiful mountain ranges, flowing rivers, peaceful forests, wineries, great food and fun people.

-You will start your day with the beautiful train ride on Metro North from Grand Central alongside the Hudson.  Along the way you will be treated to spectacular views of the Hudson Valley. You may also drive or meet the group there if you live north of the city. Please contact [masked] to make arrangements.

-Your guide will meet you in Poughkeepsie

-From there we will  head to Lake Minewaska for a fairly easy 2 mile hike through some beautiful wooded areas and waterfalls.  It is a little hilly in spots.  If you can climb a few flights of stairs you should be able to handle this one.  We will have lunch on the trail.

-After the hike we will head to 2 local wineries for some delicious wine samples..

-We will stop a a local farm stand at some point for fresh Strawberries and Blueberries

-At the end of the day you will be driven to the Walkway over the Hudson Park which is an old  train bridge that crosses the Hudson River that is now a park.

-After that it's back to the train for your ride home. You will be on the 5:54 train back to NYC.

$55 Includes: transportation from train to activities, hiking  Transportation back to train,  all taxes and tips. Train transportation is not included. Since not everyone drinks wine tastings are separate and usually $2-$10

MUST PRE-PAY TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT: PREPAY HERE https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudson-valley-spring-hike-wine-tasting-farm-stands-walkway-over-the-hudson-tickets-24816000325

Can I come alone?  Yes 97% of those attending will be coming on their own.

How hard is the hike?  This hike is very easy but you still should be in good shape. It would be 5 out of 10. with 10 being most difficult.

Refunds given only if trip is canceled due to rain.

BRING One liter of water in a backpack. Bring your lunch or purchase when you arrive.WEARWeather-appropriate athletic clothing and hiking shoes  or good sneakers. 

Refunds given only if the hike is canceled due to weather conditions.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
A two hour timed, out & back run on the Palisades Park Long Path.

Where: South entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk on the Manhattan side.

When: 10 am

Trail Details: We'll run over the GW bridge, to the Palisades long path. Then we run for 1 hour, turn around and run back. How far is that? Depends on your pace and skill level. Total run time should be 2 hours. Perhaps a bit longer, if you are tired on the way back. Perhaps a bit less, if you conserve your energy on the way out. This a great time to build your aerobic base and keep your heart rate low. This is a mild trail, great for beginners. Keep in mind though, it does tend to get more technical the farther north you go. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. Can't run for two hours? No worries, simply turn around sooner and we'll see you back at Le Chéile.

Public Transit: Take the A train to 181sth Street. Le Chéile is Located on the corner of W 181st Street and Cabrini Blvd 2 blocks from the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk.

Bag Drop/Etc: We drop our bags at Le Chéile. After we are finished hitting the trails, we head back to Le Chéile, change out of our sweaty clothes and have eggs!

By Car: Put 839 West 181st Street, Ny 10033 in your GPS

Everyone must run! No brunch bombing allowed.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be standing outside wearing BTR shirts and looking like trail runners.
results.name: Trail bRUNch! (Palisades Long Path)

results.description:
Platform program with Cora Miles and Sandy Bernabei

Using the "Human Rights" framework, the presenters Cora Miles and Sandra Bernabei will interact with participants to examine, define, and identify systemic, structural Racism which has become deeply embedded in every single system we use at every age and stage of our lives from birth to death.  
In accord with The Human Rights model, the Westchester AntiRacist Alliance will encourage workshop participants to think about, and to actively use their individual sphere(s) of influence to Undo Racism.  

Cora Miles, Educator, has devoted her career to teaching and learning with children,  families, and classroom teachers for over 30 years in the New York City Board of Education.  Following retirement as an Assistant Principal, Cora continued her journey as a teacher trainer in schools in NYC and Yonkers through Bank Street College of Education collaboration; facilitated Social and Emotional Learning workshops designed for teachers, students, parents and school administrators given at learning sites in the NYC area.


Sandra Bernabei, MSW, is a community organizer and a social worker in private practice in Westchester and NYC. She is the current President of the National Association of Social Workers-New York City Chapter. Sandy is a founding member of the Antiracist Alliance, an antiracist organizing collective of New York City area human service practitioners. ARA is building a movement to to bring an analysis of structural racism as outlined by the People's Institute for Survival and Beyond to social work education and practice.  Over 10,000 educators and Human services practitioners have participated in the undoing racism/community organizing workshops to date. 

In 2012 Sandra received Social Worker of the Year Award from NASW Westchester Division; the NASW NYC Social Work Image Award in May 2008; and In January 2008 a recognition award at the 10th anniversary of the Rockland County Drug Court for her work as founder of a grassroots community effort that established the drug court. She is a board member for The Center for the Study of White American Culture, and served on the Board of WESPAC Foundation here in Westchester. 

Regular Ethical Education for Children classes today.


9:30  Colloquy in the Leader's Study.
results.name: The Work of Undoing Racism is the Work of Human Rights - PART II

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
Our society tends to alienate us from our work, and (as a result) from the world around us. How alienating or creative is the work we do? What can we do to make our productive lives more fulfilling?
Colloquy provides opportunities for each of us to reflect on our own lives in relationship to the topic and listen and learn from one another, within the format of a sharing circle.
results.name: Sunday Colloquy: Working with Others to Re-create the World w/Carl Levine

results.description:
This is a classic 8.5 mile loop hike in Harriman State Park. We'll hike a section of the Appalachian Trail and climb to the summits of Green Pond and Island Pond Mountains, to the shore of scenic Island Pond, go through the narrow Lemon Squeezer, and pass the historic Boston Mine. We'll get off to a bit of a later start Sunday morning at the 'Elk Pen' Parking Area off Route 17 at Arden Valley Road in Tuxedo, NY. The trail is typical rocky and rolling Harriman terrain and is rated at Moderately Strenuous.

The rock formation known as the Lemon Squeezer is one of the most interesting features in Harriman State Park. Here, the Appalachian Trail climbs through a very narrow passage between the rocks and then goes up a steep rock face, where you will need to use both your hands and your feet. Those who are physically able to negotiate these challenges will probably find them to be a highlight of the hike. But if the climb is too difficult, it is possible to bypass the Lemon Squeezer by following a path to the left.

Length: 8.5 mile loop Time: 4 hours +/-

Difficulty: moderately strenuous, some steep rocky sections.

Route Type: Loop Map: NY/NJ Trail Conference #119 Pace: Moderate - after the initial climb up Green Pond Mountain, the climbs are not tough. We will take a few breaks and will keep the group together.

Driving Directions

Take I-287 North - merging briefly onto the NYS Thruway (toward Albany) but immediately exiting at 15A onto Rte 17 north (turn left at light). Then take N.Y. Route 17 north through Sloatsburg, Tuxedo and Southfields. About two miles north of Southfields, turn right onto Arden Valley Road. Cross the bridge over the New York State Thruway, then make the first right at a sign "Hikers' Trailhead Parking." Park in the newly paved parking area to the west of a large meadow, known as the Elk Pen.

Après Hike Rhodes, Sloatsburg
results.name: Island Pond Loop from Elk Pen - Harriman SP

results.description:
Richard H. Bernstein, MD will discuss How Health Care Reform Will Affect Your Doctors, Your Hospitals and You.


Workshop after Platform: Writing Your Wishes for the Final Chapter of Life. Description: A working session led by Richard H. Bernstein, MD, for explanation of key end of life issues and guidance on completing essential forms to document your wishes for care, including the Living Will, Health Care Proxy, Do Not Resuscitate and POLST.

Everyone is invited to our Platform meetings.

The Sunday School meets at the same time. The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.
results.name: How Health Care Reform Will Affect Your Doctors, Your Hospitals and You.

group.name: The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
“Even after all this time, the Sun never says to the Earth, ‘You owe me.’
Look what happens with a love like that,
It lights the whole sky.” — Hafiz

We recognize that sometimes bad things happen to good people — but also that sometimes, good things happen to us, even without our “deserving” them. Is there a better word than “blessing” for those unearned gifts of life?

This month, for our theme we’ll consider what it means to be “a people of blessing.” People who are able to give and receive. People who attribute human worth and work to bring that out in others (and thereby in themselves) — rather than just seeing others in terms of how useful they are to us. People willing to “pay it forward” and be kind, whether or not we get a reward for that from the recipient. People who are grateful for the unearned goods that come to us, from people and from life itself.

Join Leader Jone Johnson Lewis in exploring the term “blessing” from the perspective of Ethical Culture.

About the Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the clergy Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee.

More information: http://www.rysec.org/event/blessings-life
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: Sunday Platform: The Blessings of This Life

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

We are going to have a wonderful time on May 1, 2016.

Brunch will begin at 12 Noon @

BARREL & FARE

494 4th Avenue @ 12th Street

Brooklyn, NY

******YOU WILL BE ABLE TO BEGIN TO RSVP FOR THIS MEETUP ON THURSDAY, MARCH 31, 2016 @ 7 PM.****** 

• A $2.00 MEETUP FEE WILL BE CHARGED UPON ARRIVAL.

PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE OF OTHERS.

********IF YOU NEED TO CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO A NO. PLEASE DO SO BY WEDNESDAY, APRIL 27th, IN ORDER TO GIVE OTHERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO ATTEND THE MEETUP AND PURCHASE TICKETS. IF YOU END UP ON THE WAITING LIST AND YOUR PLANS CHANGE, PLEASE CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO A NO AS WELL.

• Please be prompt and ask for MIchele or Susan. We should be seated in the back of the restaurant.

Following brunch we will need to get to the Gallery Players by 2:30 pm, for a 3PM show for "In the Heights." If you arrive later than 2:30 pm, we will be downstairs.

*******IT IS IMPORTANT THAT, FOR THIS SHOW, YOU PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS AHEAD. WE WILL BE A LARGE GROUP, COMBINED WITH ANOTHER MEETUP GROUP, AND SEATS CANNOT BE HELD FOR THOSE WITHOUT ADVANCE TICKETS.

Doors open at 2:30pm, show begins at 3:00. Tickets are $18 general audience, $15 seniors (+ facility fee if purchased online), and they must be purchased in advance to secure your seat.

• Purchase your tickets here: http://galleryplayers.com/

• FOR THOSE OF WHO WHO'D LIKE TO DEFINITELY COME TO THE BRUNCH BEFOREHAND, PLEASE COMMENT BELOW THAT YOU'LL BE EATING WITH US SO A SEAT WILL BE RESERVED FOR YOU.

Here's the menu: http://barrelandfare.com/

Here is a short synopsis of the show:

"In the Heights" centers on a variety of characters living in the neighborhood of Washington Heights, on the northern tip of Manhattan. At the center of the show is Usnavi, a bodega owner who looks after the aging Cuban lady next door, pines for the gorgeous girl working in the neighboring beauty salon and dreams of winning the lottery and escaping to the shores of his native Dominican Republic. Meanwhile, Nina, a childhood friend of Usnavi’s, has returned to the neighborhood from her first year at college with surprising news for her parents, who have spent their life savings on building a better life for their daughter. Ultimately, Usnavi and the residents of the close-knit neighborhood get a dose of what it means to be home. This high-energy show features lovable characters, a contemporary Latin-flavored score and Tony-winning hip-hop dance moves. But it’s also very sweet and sentimental, wearing its heart on its sleeve. You may even get a little misty-eyed by the end.

I am looking forward to seeing all of you for a spectacular afternoon.

All the best,
Michele
results.name: Let's Meetup for brunch and a musical: "In the Heights," at The Gallery Players.

results.description: The year following Nero's suicide was marked by much political instability. From June 68 until December 69, Rome saw the rise and fall of three Emperors and the accession of a fourth. We will discuss the events of the time and the impact on the Roman Empire of the brief rule of Galba, Otho and Vitellius as well as the ten year reign of Vespasian, including his legacy of building the Coliseum and other public works.
results.name: The Year of the Four Emperors

results.description:
Pyongyang: A Journey in North Korea and Burma Chronicles by Guy Delisle translated by Helge Dascher. Next month we'll follow up with 2 more of Guy Delisle's Travel books.

Pyongyang: A Journey in North Korea


In 2001, cartoonist Guy Delisle lived in the capital of North Korea for two months on a work visa for a French film company. In this remarkable graphic novel, Delisle recorded what he was able to see of the culture and lives of one of the last remaining totalitarian communist societies.

Burma Chronicles


From the author of Pyongyang: A Journey in North Korea andShenzhen: A Travelogue from China comes Burma Chronicles, an informative look at a country that uses concealment and isolation as social control. It is drawn with Guy Delisle's minimal line, interspersed with wordless vignettes and moments of his distinctive slapstick humor.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the comics
results.name: Serial Sundays #33: Pyongyang & Burma Chronicles by Guy Delisle

Book now to guarantee your place!

SUNDAY, MAY 1, NOON: SHSNY’s 9th Annual DAY OF REASON BRUNCH

PETE’S TAVERN, 129 East 18 Street

Our speaker will be: DAVID ORENSTEIN (The Paleolibrarian)

“Godless Grace: How Non-Believers are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder”

Can we be good without god? According to their new book, Godless Grace: How Non-Believers are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder, not only do authors David Orenstein and Linda Ford Blaikie show through example that we can act morally and ethically without god belief, but with interviews of humanist boots-on-the-ground non-believer activists.

David’s fast-paced PowerPoint presentation will also discuss the history of skepticism and the current political battles the freethought movement is waging to ensure all secularists have the legal right to be free of god belief.

Brunch is just $20 ...

... for your choice of 11 entrees, tax, tips and a drink included.

Join up to 50 of your fellow and sororal freethinkers for one of SHSNY’s best annual get-togethers. Meet old friends, make new ones, schmooze, network and discuss ideas (what we do best).

But don’t wait. Our upstairs private room at Pete’s only seats 50. So guarantee your place by booking now, at www.shsny.org, using your credit card or PayPal.
results.how_to_find_us: Upstairs private room
results.name: SHSNY Day of Reason Brunch - "Godless Grace"

results.description:
[UPDATE 4/4/2016] Just noticed this yesterday, but this is the first time they have a method for ordering tickets online. Just visit their website and look for the "Click here to purchase Tricky Tray Tickets" link under their event marquee... Or just click here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/spring-luncheon-and-tricky-tray-fundraiser-tickets-22127419708?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing

Care About The Strays (dba Cats For Adoption) is an all volunteer, non-profit-501c3-organization caring for the population of homeless cats in the Rockland County, New York and surrounding areas.

Twice a year (Spring and Fall) they have a luncheon with events such as Tricky Trays, Raffles, Silent Auctions, 50/50s, and Door Prizes.
They always have beautiful gift baskets (usually 80+ baskets) that could contain anything: pet supplies, kitchen supplies, chocolates, lottery tickets (I heard last winner got $350!), wine and alcohol (so much ...) , artwork, jewelry, gift cards to local restaurants and stores, and much more!
Recently they've had tickets to sporting events and a Carribean Vacation getaway, too!

The cost has not been posted yet for this year, but the past 8 luncheons has been $35 per person to cover the lunch.

[UPDATE 3/19/2016] COST AND PURCHASE INFORMATION HAS BEEN POSTED! It is once again $35! Yay :) Please follow instructions on the included image to reserve your ticket!

You are not required to purchase anything else aside from the $35 food coverage cost (it goes to the catering hall).

All other tickets needed to participate in the Tricky Tray, Raffles, etc... are completely optional to purchase but greatly benefit the C.A.T.S. organization.
I usually spend about $60 extra with the 50/50s and all the gift baskets to give you all an idea - but I'm a crazy cat person :)

Please purchase your own tickets separately, and THEN RSVP here.

I will get there early and reserve seats at an empty table for us. I'll bring a balloon or something so it's easy to find our table.

By the way, the food generally goes like this:
12:15pm - Cheese and crackers buffet (we get up and get it)
Pitcher of Soda and Water brought to the table for everyone
1:00pm - Bread, butter, fruit and more picky food like breadsticks, mozzerrella, prosciutto, artichokes, mushrooms... you know, typical Italian antipasto (we get up and get it)
2:00pm - Dinner buffet with about 6 options including eggplant parm, California blend veggies, a fish dish, chicken dish, potatos, and I can't remember the other option! (we get up and get it)
3:00pm - They bring us cake and ice cream and coffee or tea!

You can leave whenever you want, but who wants to miss cake?!

Between the food eating, you'll put your tickets in the tricky tray bags and they'll start calling out winners.

Dress code is:  Not a gown or tuxedo, but please don't show up in ripped shorts and a wife beater. Cat themed attire is always a plus. Jeans are perfectly fine. Be comfortable, but not sloppy.

It's a lot of fun and supports a great cause!

Web Site: http://www.catsforadoption.org/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Care-About-The-Strays-Cats-For-Adoption-432013083659010
results.name: Spring Luncheon for Care About the Strays

venue.name: Rear end of Brooklyn-bound platform for A/C/F train at Jay St./Metrotech

results.description:
There are more than 200 works of art--mainly mosaics, murals, and sculptures--on the platforms, walls, and floors of the NYC subways, many of them unknown or barely noticed by harried commuters. Let's transform the subway experience into a fun and inspiring afternoon, by visiting many of the city's most beautiful art installations under the ground. Our route will cover those sites without having to travel more than one stop at a time. We'll exit and re-enter the subway three times (a fourth is optional)--see COST below.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

WALKING DISTANCE: About 1 mile, including some ups and downs on the stairs.

PACE: Moderate (3 blocks per 4 minutes), NOT SLOW. If you want to stroll rather than walk moderately, this is not the right event for you.

LUNCH: At around 2:30 we'll stop at the Port Authority concourse, which houses about 10 inexpensive restaurants, mostly deli, pizza, and pubs. Most have ample seating, and you may be able to sit there with food you've brought from home (except in the pubs), especially if you buy something as well, which I'd recommend. If necessary, there are also seats downstairs, in the waiting area for buses.


COST: $7.50 for fares (unless you have an unlimited Metrocard), since we'll be exiting and  re-entering the subway at Penn Station, Port Authority and Grand Central. Other costs: whatever you pay for food, plus $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee

ENDING TIME: Around 5:30 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: The subway platform where we're meeting is on the A, C, and F lines; you can also get there via the R train and walking through the station to the A/C/F platform. Consult tripplanner.mta.org and/or  a subway map (available online by googling).

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. Wait lists of up to 90 people have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute (though there's no guarantee).
results.how_to_find_us: Once you're on the Brooklyn-bound platform, figure out where the rear of the trains stop, by asking people if necessary. If you're still unsure, walk to both ends of the platform and look for me (red cap) and the group at about 12:15 (leaving 12:30).
results.name: "Beauty in the Subways" replaces "Lower Manhattan" due to rain

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

results.description:
Theme for May 1: "Outdoors"

It's May Day so it seems like a fitting day to celebrate springtime/summer and the great outdoors. We'll have lots of plants and green bricks/platforms for your LEGO gardening pleasure. We'll also have grays and browns to create desert scenes and rock sculptures. Bring a set you'd like to build with friends*, show something interesting you've already built (or pictures), or just bring yourself! Feel free to bring anything you like, but bonus points for bringing something outdoorsy.

ACTIVITIES:
Build Contest - Using the bricks on hand at the meetup build an "outdoors" scene and we'll vote for our favorite to win a small Lego set prize.

Free Build - As always, there will be a big pile of pieces for free building throughout the afternoon.

Additional Builds/Sharing TBD - based on what members bring*

* When you bring a set for shared building at the event, you are not donating it, but just enjoying building it with others. You take your set back home.

Note on Fees:
We're charging a small fee so that we can get a better handle on attendance. We want to make sure that we have plenty of table space for everyone to build, but also hate to waste money on larger rooms for no-shows. Refunds available if you change your RSVP more than 36 hours in advance. Otherwise, we have an optional pay-what-you-can policy. Feel free to contribute (or not) via credit card here on Meetup or in cash at events. Lego can be an expensive hobby and we want this group to remain accessible to everyone. We welcome casual fans, serious AFOLs, and newbies alike.

Fees go towards snacks, beer, wine, soda, room costs, Lego prizes, and meetup fees.
results.name: May 1 NYC Lego Meetup for AFOL "The Outdoors"

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Strategic Multidimensional Life Planning: 
"Existential Inversion" 
with Ashley Melidosian 


CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP.

 

This course introduces and explores more profoundly the subject of Existential Inversion. Existential inversion is an advanced evolutionary strategy which a person can use to help execute their life task (existential program).

The idea behind the inversion technique is to help the person connect to their period of planning between lifetimes (intermissive course) at an earlier age, allowing them to remember their innate multidimensional (spiritual) values earlier on in the physical dimension, and hence be able to lucidly build their life around these values.  

This course is based on the premise that a deeper understanding of the inversion technique and the reasons behind such a technique, can assist all interested individuals to execute their existential program in the physical dimension, regardless of other specific techniques they may decide to implement.  

Through the understanding and deeper analyses of the inversion technique today, we can have a better understanding of what we can do tomorrow (both in this lifetime and in future lives). In this course, we will:  

• Describe who can benefit from applying the existential inversion technique

• Discuss principles inversion

• List postures and attitudes which act as both facilitators and obstacles towards completing our life task when using the inversion technique

• Point out and clarify some myths or misinformation about existential inversion

• Q&A on this technique and related subjects

Prices: 

Members: $79 
Non-Members: $89 

Special 'Package' pricing for this class plus Saturday's class on Human Potential: 
Members: $105
Non-Members: $125
results.how_to_find_us: 59th and Lex subway is closest. The entrance to our building is under the palace restaurant awning near the corner of 57th and Lex.
results.name: Strategic Multidimensional Life Planning:  "Existential Inversion"

Volunteers are needed to help sort and pack food pantry donations for local senior citizens.  Bread of Life provides food to families and over 17 church & government food pantries and shelters throughout southern Westchester County.  Come be a part of this great organization for the day!

About Bread of Life:

Bread of Life is a Rye, NY based not-for-profit organization committed to serving our neighborhood. It is the only food rescue organization, which also has its own on-site food pantry. We pick up locally and deliver free of charge to neighborhood food pantries, soup kitchens and shelters, serving over 9,000 hungry weekly. Bread of Life receives its food supplies from various sources, but one unique source is donations by local businesses of excess food that would otherwise be discarded as waste.  Bread of Life’s beneficiaries are not only physically hungry, but are also in need of assurance that their lives are matter.

**If you plan on volunteering with your child please include them in your rsvp as a +1 and let me know their name and age in the comments section.  All minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.  Thanks!**

results.description:
this meetup will be repeating every two weeks like our veggie heaven bi weekly....
BUT, unlike our Veggie Heaven meetups, we need to have people who RSVP show up and be close to on time..........
If you need to call,[masked] 1066. please RSVP, unless you decide at the last moment to come, which is ok, if you call me. but if you decide at the last minute NOT to come, please be sure to call and tell me, so we don't reserve a table for 4 people who aren't coming, and get a chair thrown at us, or worse, a real cheese omelet.
please come on time, we will not be seated without all present, or we will be seated in increments as we show up, and will be dispersed. the management is willing to work with/accommodate us, but we need to meet them halfway, and as of late, we have not been consistent....  they want us all present before they reserve seats for us, they will not give us a table of 8 if only 4 are there in person.  they have reserved seating for 16 of us in the past only to have only 8 of us show up. they can't afford to keep seats empty waiting for no-shows during their busiest business hours. this has happened more than once. in regard to event time, the pancake house closes at 3pm, but sometimes lets customers linger. please do not count on this and show up at 3:45, it irks the management, and sometimes they do actually eject people at 3pm on the dot. please come as close to 1:30 as you can and communicate with me if you are having timeliness issues, decide at the last minute to come, or want to cancel, so we know what to expect for seating.....

as an aside, please consider;
The real reason why this event is called 'pancakes from hell'..... today(4/3/2016), we had a chair AND a REAL, really cheesy-cheese omelet thrown at us for taking up reserved chair/customer space, which lay fallow, costing the establishment moo-la. we need to be more consistent with our RSVP' status's and attendance times when it comes to our pancake events. otherwise there is hell for me to pay in my relations with this proprietor-(flames shot from his eye sockets). i am a regular at the pancake house, i live 5 blocks away, and to be a thorn in their side takes the fun out of an event, and makes patronizing their establishment on my own less pleasant for me. i don't deserve this. anyone's lack of compliance in my attendance guidelines screws up my relationship with this place of business, and i take this very personally.  please mind your RSVP's, i understand everyone here is human and might have issues, but please take my cell number and call to cancel if you choose to do so, close to, or after, attendance time. pick up the phone, it's the least you can do. please don't make me start counting indiscretions and banning people. :-(
thank you for your consideration.
results.how_to_find_us: please attend on time, or cancel if not coming. we will not be seated unless we all show. otherwise, increments of 4 or 6 will be seated, as we show up, separating us. many haven't been consistent with their RSVPs, resulting in a luke warm staff
results.name: pancakes from hell, maywood location

results.description:
Cerámica de los Ancestros: Central America's Past Revealed

Join us for a special guided tour in Spanish at the National Museum of the American Indian. We'll discover Central America's diverse and dynamic ancestral heritage throughout the ceramics featured in this exhibition. Cerámica de los Ancestros examines seven regions representing distinct Central American cultural areas that are today part of Belize, Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, and Panama. These objects at the exhibition ( works in gold, jade, shell, and stone) illustrate the richness, complexity, and dynamic qualities of the Central American civilizations that were connected to peoples in South America, Mesoamerica, and the Caribbean through social and trade networks sharing knowledge, technology, artworks, and systems of status and political organization. 

The group will have a picnic at Battery Park after the tour. This is a unique opportunity to learn about Hispanic culture, meet great people and practice Spanish.

WHO: Anybody interested in learning about Hispanic culture


WHEN: May 1, 2016

TIME: 2:00 pm - 3:30 pm (meeting time 1:30 pm)

WHERE: National Museum of the American Indian

WHY: To learn about culture, practice Spanish and meet great people

HOW MUCH: $10 in advance ($15 at the door if space is available)

Allá nos vemos.

Jorge

results.description:
11th ANNUAL OPEN

BELTANE SABBAT CELEBRATION IN TOMPKINS SQ. PARK

Sunday, May 1, 2016  2:00 - 5pm

It's May, It's May, the Lusty Month of May!  Welcome, welcome one and ALL
Wiccan Family Temple are pleased and proud to once again host this gathering, as we come together to share in the May Day festivities.  In ye olde tradition we will have a MAYPOLE DANCING, JUMPING THE CAULDRON.  A VERY BARDIC BELTANE.

As we welcome Beltane/Beltaine one of our festivals as the celebration of two powers joining to bring creation, in this case, the Goddess and the God. The two forming a sacred union, from which comes creation, growth and harmony. The God, now grown, becomes enraptured with the Goddess and from their love, all of nature grows and flowers. It is a time of sensuality and sexuality, the reawakening of the earth in vivid colors, vibrant scents, fresh greenery and the sheer joy of summer after a long dormant winter.

We have A Beltane ritual, complete with songs and chants for everyone to join in on.  

FOR MAYPOLE DANCING, bring *at least* 25 feet (30 is better) of ribbon in a color that reflects what you would like to weave into your life this year.  Must be there by 2pm to attach ribbon to Maypole.*EVERYONE* is welcome, of all races, creeds, genders, ages; solitaries, covens, families & friends, et al. We are respectful of all spiritual paths and all peoples.

THERE WILL ALSO BE A CHILDRENS MAYPOLE THIS YEAR TO BRING YOUR KIDS WITH YOU TO ENJOY TIHIS SABBAT.


The costs is $15.00 in person $16.00 via online payments. (please bring receipt of online payment) , which helps defray the costs of hosting this event.
BRING FOODS AND DRINKS TO SHARE: wines, juices, cakes, seasonal breads, fruits, grapes, cookies, veggies and dips, etc...

BRING HAND INSTRUMENTS -- drums, flutes, tambourines, claves, maracas, etc.*PLEASE* RSVP us as soon as possible so we can get an accurate estimate of the attendees -- so we can bring enough supplies!

You can RSVP us through [masked], and payments via online at http://www.meetup.com/CharmedByStarrWitchesofNewYork/events/219489936/.

Attire: Suggested colors are pink, yellow, green, violet, red, white (not required for attendance). Celebrants can draw a spiral on foreheads or cheeks or draw a flower on cheek or Triangles for the triple Goddess. 

Look out for Ribbons, Balloons, Maypoles…

Phone: (347)[masked]

Blessed Be, one and all!

More details to follow. $15 in person/$16 online
results.how_to_find_us: Look for signs of balloons or ribbons... we will try to be visible as possible.
results.name: 11th Annual Beltane Celebration

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Agricola, Tzolkin, etc.) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. In addition, many take a long time to teach (Alchemists runs about 30 minutes, Kanban's teach ran 1 hour last time).  Among the shortest games we play are Codenames and Splendor.  If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game. Towards the late evening, Avalon often happens.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.

Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, the card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Sunday Marathon in Flushing

2pm-4pm (Admission $10 per person; Children 12 and under admitted for free)

venue.name: The Ark and Sacred Arts Research Foundation

results.description:
http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53e3c23ee4b018c6bdf89fdb/t/570fee0c4c2f85c45c6ef02a/1460661779198/?format=500w

Alfredo Zagaceta and Moises Llerena, two master visionary painters from the Peruvian Amazon visited our community last year with their spectacular shamanic paintings. Alfredo and Moises were trained from their teenage years onwards by the legendary shaman and world famous painter, Pablo Amaringo, in the unique visionary and mystical style of neo-amazonian art. 


http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53e3c23ee4b018c6bdf89fdb/t/570fec2fa3360cbe836861f3/1460661315328/?format=500w Original Painting done by Alfredo Zagacea

Alfredo and Moises blessed us with a large body of their work and asked us to help them share their paintings with people across the United States. This is the only place outside of the jungle to see such a large collection of original Amazonian art for sale.

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53e3c23ee4b018c6bdf89fdb/t/570feda120c6470299b3b739/1460661670193/?format=500w Moises Llerena in his studio

Alfredo and Moises also requested for us to help them share tapestries, clothing, and fabrics created by the Shipibo people of the Peruvian Amazon, a ancient shamanic culture that has retained a sacred relationship with the natural world, which they depict through their unique visionary and sacred geometric embroidery. 

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53e3c23ee4b018c6bdf89fdb/t/570fed0b45bf214978fc8a78/1460661540760/?format=500w Alfredo and Moises also requested for us to help them share tapestries, clothing, and fabrics created by the Shipibo people of the Peruvian Amazon, a ancient shamanic culture that has retained a sacred relationship with the natural world, which they depict through their unique visionary and sacred geometric embroidery.

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/53e3c23ee4b018c6bdf89fdb/t/570fef1dc6fc087c170292e6/1460662061160/?format=500w We will also have various indigenous musical instruments for sale such as handcrafted professional quality didgeridoos and custom shamanic drums for sale along with visionary beadwork, exotic, incense, and fabrics from Guatemala.

Entrance is free

results.description:
Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. I bring a bunch of cards and some pre-made decks, so we always have enough stuff for all. Feel free to bring your own decks (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.) along if you want. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

*UPDATE REGARDING FINANCIAL INPUT: we have now gone to a yearly dues format, which if everyone in the group pays, we will have more than enough to cover the cost of being on Meetup. If not everyone pays, it may have to increase, but only slightly (right now at $2/yr.) The real purpose of why this group is here is to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.

results.description:
This is always a lot of fun........ 

Remember>>>

We had such a good time the last time we met for karaoke....let us do it again!! For only $14.00 each, you can stay all afternoon  from 2pm until 8pm ..... we get our own private room to eat, drink, laugh, talk, dance, and most of all SING OUR FAVORITE SONGS in.  If you stay less than 3 hours, the charge is $5.00 per hour.

 If you don't want to sing ...no problem....you can just say "I pass"  and watch the videos ( a video is shown with each song), and listen to the rest of us sing. OR.... you can choose a song and invite us to all sing it together.

You can bring food or buy something from their menu. You can stay for as little or as long as you wish (until 8pm)

 You are not allowed to bring any drinks with you, not even water but.... they have a bar and the drinks are very reasonable: Water=$1.00,  Soda=$2.00, a Long Island Ice Tea = $8.00 etc.

To me this is a fun venue.  Where else can you go in MidTown Manhattan,  meet your friends,  and party all afternoon for only $14.00 ???

Go online to "Duet 53" and review their "song list".  Be sure to write down the name and number of the songs you would like to hear, or sing.  (keep looking until you find the list)......then, when you come , you will not have to spend a lot of time looking through the song books....Remember the door to Duet 53 is on 53rd street; off the N.E. corner of 8th avenue.  see you there

results.description:
Join us this SUNDAY! For an introduction to project Alexandria, blockchain based content publishing Decentralized System and AirBitz, a blockchain security SDK.

Alexandria allows  for the distribution and sales of digital content that lets anyone sell their content independently & directly, and in addition to building the protocol Blocktech will be showing it’s first DApp, the Alexandria browser..

http://blocktech.com/

Paul Puey, CEO of San Diego based blockchain security startup Airbitz, will present and demo their cross platform SDK. The Airbitz SDK also gives cross platform bitcoin/blockchain functionality to mobile apps enabling them to send, receive, and secure bitcoin with the ease of a Paypal like API. Paul will also cover the ramifications of new protocols such as the Lightning Network and Payments Codes; and how the Airbitz data model, called Edge Security, plays a critical role in enabling these technologies.
results.name: Introduction to Alexandria and an Introduction Airbitz SDK for Edge Security
