results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3-5pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Sunday Drop-In Improv Class 3-5pm ($10)

Please join us on Sunday for meditation instruction and sitting practice. Developed for beginners as well as experienced meditators, this afternoon session will include guided instruction by an experienced teacher, and discussion and opportunity for questions and comments. More details:http://www.theidproject.org/events/2015/05/03/sundays-weekly-introduction-meditation 

Recent scientific research suggests that meditation practice is an effective means to lessening stress and depression, boosting bodily immune and respiratory functions, increasing happiness and cultivating compassion and joy within one's life.

Please arrive by 2:50 to settle into your seat for the program. Chairs and cushions will be available. We request a $5-$10 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds. 

Note we are located on the 2nd Floor of a walkup building.  We have no elevator. 

The Interdependence Project 
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer 
Between Houston and 1st Street

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
RSVP's start Sunday, April 17th at 9:00pm. Note this one has a pre-pay fee of $10 per person which is for the museum admission and tour. 

You don't have to be Jewish to enjoy this tour :)!  A truly spectacular restored landmark:  Open since 1887, we'll discover the history, architecture and spiritual significance of the Eldridge Street Synagogue, the first great house of worship built by East European immigrants in America.

After our one-hour guided tour inside, we'll venture out into the neighborhood for a 90-minute to 2-hour tour to explore remnants of the past as well as the many changes that have occurred over the years.  In short, we'll cover the history, past, present and future, the beginning of the garment industry, fun food purveyors, tenement history, push cart vendors and more.

We'll have the usual social option when we are finished.

Cheers from Hank

[masked]

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description: The term “Bible stories” sounds harmless and family-friendly, but the truth is that many of these tales are for adults only. Consider the account of Noah getting drunk and naked. Or Lot having relations with his daughters. Or Judah with his daughter-in-law, Tamar. And let’s not forget the rape of Dinah and the ensuing vengeance and slaughter. Besides the temple prostitutes and orgies, there is enough murder and mayhem, conniving and deceit to make a good Netflix series! Come find out about all the stories they never taught you in Sunday School!

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ Frederick Douglass Playground


                                 Check our Facebook page:

              facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                          NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41MNlrZf-MY

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 7 on 7, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Frederick Douglass Playground


Take the 1,2 or 3 RED Line Train to 96th street Station and walk 4 blocks down, to 101st Street and Amsterdam Ave. or the 1 RED Line Train to 103rd Street Station and walk 1 block.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
We're going to commemorate the Mexican army's unlikely victory over French forces at the Battle of Puebla on May 5, 1862 by eating - 

Tacos!

The word just brings a smile to our faces. There isn't the leaden gravity of burrito 

or the complexity of enchilada,

let alone the revulsion of chimichanga

(only the USofA would think to take a burrito and deep fry it - thanks Arizona!).

Taco!

Tacos are the most brilliant expression of Mexican cuisine. They're punctuation marks, intonation and intention all expressed by a soft or hard tortilla waiting to be filled with all manner of goodness.

This will go down as the easiest VegOut potluck anyone could ever attend. You don't have to bring a dish to share. You only need to bring one or two taco ingredients. You could bring any of the following or whatever else strikes your fancy as long as it's vegan (no meat, dairy, eggs or honey):

• Mexican style beans


• guacamole (or plain avocado)


• jalapenos


• spiced lentils


• diced tomatoes


• romaine lettuce


• cheeze sauce

• cilantro 


• vegan sour cream


• and so on and so on and so on!

Search 'vegan tacos' and get a slew of ideas.


Please post what ingredient you're bringing.

The only limit is your imagination. Ok, honestly I'd steer away from okra but that's just me.

We'll supply the tortillas which will be from Hot Bread Kitchen. If you don't know them, get to know them. Their products are widely available at NYC Greenmarkets, too (<a>https://hotbreadkitchen.org).</a>;  Their Heritage Corn Tortillas are made with 100% organic, non-GMO corn. They make their tortillas the traditional way: stone-grinding fresh corn and they add nothing but a little lime to soften the kernel’s skin. No Monsanto or ConAgra yuck.

Our Plan:

We assemble between 4:30-5:00p.

We then set up our taco bar buffet and dig in!

In addition to the tortillas, sangria will be provided. If you wish for something non-alcoholic or if sangria isn't your thing, then please bring whatever you'd like to drink.

Accessibility:

The Kew Gardens/Union Turnpike subway stop is accessible. There is an elevator from the platform and then an elevator to the street. If for any reason an elevator is out, Forest Hills/71st Ave is also accessible. KG/UT stop is serviced by the E/F trains. The KG Long Island Railroad stop is also accessible. You must be in the first four cars of the train to exit at the station. If you come by the LIRR and don't have a monthly pass buy the City Ticket for $4.25 (that's one way) instead of the usual Off-Peak $6.00.  Our host's building is accessible via basement access. Otherwise there are steps into the lobby and steps up to the lobby level elevators. The basement access is entirely wheelchair accessible with direct elevator access.

Our host's apartment is three blocks from the subway or one and a half blocks from the LIRR.

8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

results.description:
This year we'll be talking about the Holodomor, also known as the Ukrainian famine of 1932-33.  From Wikipedia:


The Holodomor (Ukrainian: Голодомо́р, "Extermination by hunger" or "Hunger-extermination"; derived from морити голодом, "to kill by starvation") was a man-made famine in the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic in 1932 and 1933 that killed an estimated 2.5–7.5 million Ukrainians, with millions more counted in demographic estimates. It was part of the wider disaster, the Soviet famine of 1932–33, which affected the major grain-producing areas of the country.

During the Holodomor, which is also known as the "Terror-Famine in Ukraine" and "Famine-Genocide in Ukraine", millions of citizens of the Ukrainian SSR, the majority of whom were ethnic Ukrainians, died of starvation in a peacetime catastrophe unprecedented in the history of Ukraine. Since 2006, the Holodomor has been recognized by the independent Ukraine and 14 other countries as a genocide of the Ukrainian people carried out by the Soviet Union.

Early estimates of the death toll by scholars and government officials varied greatly; anywhere from 1.8 to 12 million ethnic Ukrainians were said to have perished as a result of the famine. Recent research has since narrowed the estimates to between 2.4 and 7.5 million. The exact number of deaths is hard to determine, due to a lack of records, but the number increases significantly when the deaths inside heavily Ukrainian-populated Kuban are included. Older estimates are still often cited in political commentary. According to the findings of the Court of Appeal of Kyiv in 2010, the demographic losses due to the famine amounted to 10 million, with 3.9 million direct famine deaths, and a further 6.1 million birth deficit.

Scholars disagree on the relative importance of natural factors and bad economic policies as causes of the famine but believe it was a long-term plan of Joseph Stalin, an attempt to eliminate the Ukrainian independence movement. Using Holodomor in reference to the famine emphasizes its man-made aspects, arguing that actions such as rejection of outside aid, confiscation of all household foodstuffs, and restriction of population movement confer intent, defining the famine as genocide; the loss of life has been compared to the Holocaust. If Soviet policies and actions were conclusively documented as intending to eradicate the rise of Ukrainian nationalism, they would fall under the legal definition of genocide.

results.description:
We are now offering Intro to Yoga classes once a week. Come join us in May for some basics and fun in a semi-private atmosphere. This class series is perfect for those who are new to yoga or would like to return to the basics. In these introduction classes, you will learn basic moves, conscious breathing, foundational poses, correct alignment, and techniques to relax and focus. You do not need to be flexible, athletic or injury-free to join this class! Everyone is welcome.

WHEN:
- May 1, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 8, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 15, 2016, 5:00-6:30
- May 22, 2016, 5:00-6:30

INVESTMENT: 1 class for $27, 2 classes for $50 pre-paid, 1 class for $30 day off. 
Space is Limited, please register in advance.

results.description:
Celebrate our connection to the Divine Mother, the Divine within You!

Sacred Womb Healing Ceremony with guest Doña Leova from Mexico in Honor of May Day

Let us gather and celebrate in a nourishing circle of women. We will embrace the divine feminine, the beauty and power of the womb and cycles of nature, and the goddess and mother within you!

We will honor ourselves, our ancestors, and the ultimate mother, Mother Earth, in a joyous and expansive evening featuring special guest from Mexico, healer Doña Leova with Sarah Eve Cardell.

“The noble woman is the goddess which Almighty God worships. It is the altar to which God bows. It is the grace which produces God's soul. It is the ultimate infinity of all virtues. It is the power of all kindness and blessing of God, and the noble woman is the essence of all prayers.” -Yogi Bhajan

We will journey to the womb, healing and releasing any energies that prevent us from being in our juicy, empowered, and creative flow, perform sacred rituals to honor our ancestors and ourselves, receive divine messages and inspiration, and enjoy high-vibrational organic vegan chocolate and tonics.

Please wear a skirt or dress if you feel called, bring any pictures of inspiring women or photos of your ancestors, and an open heart to be filled with bliss!

Cost: $33 per person prepaid.

Bring a sister, Mother, Aunt, Grandma, daughter, niece, or another goddess friend and get a discount-
2 tickets for $60.

Ladies only please.

Date: Sunday May 1st 2016

Time: 5-7:00pm

Where: Floating Lotus
39 West 56th Street
NYC 10019

RSVP with paypal for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=6WB9QGE6YJCPU

RSVP with paypal for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=F6ECSADQQQSFL

Doña Leova is a Traditional Healer from the Nahuatl Indian nation of Puebla, Mexico. Her work is based in a cosmology of healing that is known as the "Tradition of the Grandmothers"..... named because historically, one grandmother would share the practice with one granddaughter who would then go on to become the next practitioner. Renowned and respected for the ancestral wisdom she carries, Doña openly shares ancient rituals, healing practices and Sacred Prayers from her community in the Mexican forests. In this workshop, she will guide us thru powerful rituals and techniques to deepen our awareness of the Healing Spirits in nature and further awaken our abilities to heal, purify, protect and Bless ourselves and our loved ones. Together we will dissolve limitations and welcome Joy.

Sarah Eve Cardell is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki healer and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500-hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience as a gourmet holistic chef, she uses food as another tool in achieving whole body health. Whether in private healing sessions, workshops and retreats, she facilitates a space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2016 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: May Day Healing Ceremony with Dona Leova from Mexico

results.description:
Ever wondered about the Green Man? Well, if you enjoy storytelling and community celebrations of life and love and joy - you are invited! May 1st is the Beltane celebration in Celtic traditions. After your family and nature weekend celebrations - come to Neolyth to relax, share some berry pies, berry juice, berry tea, all forest and green theme feasting with us… Storytelling with drums and flutes and bells as well as a meditation with the Green Goddess of Nature!…

Door open at 5pm to organize the food, socialize and get all seated comfortably, storytelling starts at 6pm with opening of sacred circle, story and guided imagery to meet the Green Man, followed by healing with the Goddess meditation...

Please bring forest and green themed food to share. Thank you! Donations to support Neolyth welcomed, $15 or more!

"Beltane honours Life. It represents the peak of Spring and the beginning of Summer. Earth energies are at their strongest and most active. All of life is bursting with potent fertility and at this point in the Wheel of the Year, the potential becomes conception. On May Eve the sexuality of life and the earth is at its peak. Abundant fertility, on all levels, is the central theme. The Maiden goddess has reached her fullness. She is the manifestation of growth and renewal, Flora, the Goddess of Spring, the May Queen, the May Bride. The Young Oak King, as Jack-In-The-Green, as the Green Man, falls in love with her and wins her hand. The union is consummated and the May Queen becomes pregnant. Together the May Queen and the May King are symbols of the Sacred Marriage (or Heiros Gamos), the union of Earth and Sky, and this union has merrily been re-enacted by humans throughout the centuries. For this is the night of the Greenwood Marriage. It is about sexuality and sensuality, passion, vitality and joy. And about conception. A brilliant moment in the Wheel of the Year to bring ideas, hopes and dreams into action. And have some fun….."
from https://www.goddessandgreenman.co.uk
results.name: Green Man and the Goddess - Storytelling and Potluck Party!

In this class, Rev. Daniel Neusom opens his channel to The Holy Spirit Of God and The Arc Angelic Realms to channel a path of healing and transformation for the group and the individual participants. We use prayer and meditation  to faciliate deep clearing and transformation,

 For further information please call Rev. Daniel Neusom before attending the your first class.  [masked]  There is a $20 dollar donation for each session.

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Advanced degrees suggested by not required.

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Smarty Pants SpeedMeeting -  1F/1M SPOTS LEFT - Advanced Degree Singles 25-39

results.name: Smarty Pants SpeedMeeting -  2F/2M SPOTS LEFT - Advanced Degree Singles 25-39

results.description:
Advanced degrees suggested by not required.

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?


Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.


*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Smarty Pants SpeedMeeting -  1F/2M SPOTS LEFT - Advanced Degree Singles 25-39

results.description:
Tickets: $19-24


Click the link below to purchase a ticket to this event:


http://www.bigmaven.com/experience/ny-adventure-club-after-hours-tour-italian-american-museum/

Join New York Adventure Club for an after-hours tour of the Italian American Museum, which highlights the struggles of Italian Americans, and their achievements and contributions to American culture and society.

The museum is located in a restored and preserved historic building on the corner of Mulberry and Grand Streets that once housed “Banca Stabile” — founded by Francesco Rosario Stabile in 1885, Banca Stabile was a link for the Immigrants in the United States with their relatives in Italy, and provided a range of services including banking, telegraph communication, steam ship travel logistics, import-export, notary public, and mailing/shipping.

Afterwards, we’ll grab some Italian food in the neighborhood!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: After-Hours Tour @ Italian American Museum

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

This week we will host one of our famous Pot Luck Dinners in the parish center under the church!  


IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO CONTRIBUTE A DISH PLEASE EMAIL JoAnne AT [masked]


What can I bring?  Meat, fish, veggie main courses, soup, salads, sides, dessert, wine,


How much should I make?  It is up to you.  You don't have to feed the whole group as there will be other dishes there.  So a tray or potful of anything is appreciate.


Is there a place to heat or cook?  Yes the parish center has a full kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave, pots pans etc.

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last? Usually around 9ish

Cost:  $10 donation goes to help cover our costs for incidentals.  Pay at door.  Anything extra will be put into the CRC Holy Trinity account

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
https://youtu.be/lTvdtdAcxDI

Join us on Sunday May 1st for another great night of Cinema Italiano! 

At 7:00 pm we will show:  - in Original Italian with English Subtitles - 
Gli Equilibristi, 2012 by Ivano De Matteo

Tickets on Sale until Saturday include: Movie, PopCorn, Soda, and thanks to our sponsor Peroni, a complimentary Beer at Emporio Restaurant right after the movie! 

Plot: 
Giulio is forty years old and leads an apparently peaceful life. He lives in a rented apartment, has a steady job, a car purchased in installments, a rebellious but nice daughter, a sweet son who’s a dreamer, a wife (Barbora Bobulova) he loves and is unfaithful to. She discovers Giulio’s affair, leaves him and his fairy-tale life suddenly crumbles.But what happens to a couple who “dare” separate from each other in this day and age?Through a wide array of events that are at times tragic and at times ironic, the film takes us hand-in-hand into the world of a man who suddenly discovers how thin the line between well-being and poverty truly is.


Cast: 

Valerio Mastandrea, Barbora Bobulova, Maurizio Casagrande, Rolando Ravello, Grazia Schiavo,Antonio Gerardi, Antonella Attili, Stefano Masciolini,Giorgio Gobbi, Francesca Antonelli, Damir Todorovic, Antonio Tallura, Paola Tiziana Cruciani,Rosabel Laurenti Sellers,  


https://youtu.be/lTvdtdAcxDI

results.description:
Experiencing a love connection can bring tremendous joy in a healthy relationship. However, when love does not work, it can be extremely painful. It can bring about feelings of being stuck, having low self-esteem, feeling depressed or even health issues.

Did you ever ask yourself--

Why can't I leave or let go of the relationship?

What makes me stay?

This support groups offers more than just talk. During our session, in addition to honest-open sharing, members will experience a series of fun and eye-opening activities where you’ll explore meditation, role playing, educational readings and structured exercises within a safe, confidential. and supportive environment.

Join us for a transformative experience while connecting with other members struggling with similar issues on a journey to creating fulfilling relationships, healing and/or letting go of unhealthy ones. Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life. We will also share about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

Who can attend?

Anyone who is feeling stuck, empty, or frustrated in a relationship and is ready to work towards a happier future in life and love. We welcome people at all steps of their journey – whether you’ve been to a support group, meet-up, counseling or a newcomer!

What should I bring?

Desire to change and an open mind!

How much does it cost?

$10 per Session

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the next session 

This group is facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach. Debbie brings her personal experiences of navigating through and triumphing over the difficulties of toxic relationships.

Not able to make our monthly meeting, but want to learn more about our group or individual sessions? Reach out to our organizer, Debbie for more information at [masked].

Week #1 New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

: Sun, May 01 - Sun, Jun 19, 2016


Sun


7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM


# of Sessions: 6

102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm

Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed

103: Lindy Hop﻿

Pre-Intermediate

8:30- 9:30pm


Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]


Level one is now on Wednesday nights!


Register and pricing below:

jccmanhattan.org/dance

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Sean Patton (Jimmy Fallon), Chris DiStefano (MTV Guy Code), Gary Vider, Liza Treyger, Damien Lemon (Guy Code, Last Comic Standing).

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
For this dinner party you are asked to pick a city, any city. Most large cities have distinctive foods they're known for across the country. Chicago's deep-dish pizza or Philadelphia's Philly Cheese Steaks are just two examples. 

To participate please let us know the name of the city you chose, and the dish that you will be making. To make things a little more challenging, and in the interest of having a good variety of foods... each city may only be chosen once. Therefore, if someone chose New York you may not choose New York as well. 

Please bring at least one city themed dish to this dinner. If you wish to drink with us please also contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail as well. 

This is a potluck dinner so you should bring your dishes prepared but you can do finishing touches in the apartment. 


The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of May 1st.  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

Episode 2 "Home"

All are welcome. If you are a fan of the HBO Game of Thrones and want to join a group of fellow fans, come on in. If you are a full fledged Maester who has read all of the books (and even the extras like Dunk & Egg) come join us and watch the marvelous series with a group of fellow Maesters. Discussion about anything we just watched is encouraged here (and since the show has passed the books, talk about the books is also encouraged). This group does not consider mentioning Ned Stark's beheading in Season 1 during Season 6 to be a spoiler.*

There is a delicious and very affordable menu of food and drinks for you to enjoy when you get here.

8PM

Discuss, debate, and compare notes while watching last week's show.

9PM

Watch new episode (without debate or talking so we don't miss anything).

10PM

Socialize and discuss the show.

Come early to get the best seats.

*It is highly recommended that people who consider a wide range of topics to be spoilers watch the show alone at home with the doors locked and the internet disconnected. Make sure to also avoid all news outlets.

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Princess for a Day

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

If you have questions about the project, write to Jace at [masked].


See you soon!
results.name: Volunteer Community Oven Building with Pat the mason - Monday

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description: SQL basics today! The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient. For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM.

Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Come join Bi+ and Bi-friendly people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic-oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.


2016 Scheduling Change:  Starting in January 2016, we're adjusting our discussion meetings to accommodate our late shift workers and evening class students.. Hopefully if you have class on (the first) Monday, you can make it on (the third) Thursday of any given month.    

About us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest continues the work of hosting biweekly discussions and monthly social gatherings serving the New York City metropolitan area; we've been rocking our bi selves since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals of ever stripe (bi, fluid, queer, pan, omni, sapio, and so many more).  And we welcome bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion.  We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

Place: Creative Lebanese small plates ideal for sharing in a trendy space that also serves cocktails.

http://www.ililinyc.com/


Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos. 

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
Metro/Techstars Present Global Trend in Food Tech and Restaurant Services as Part of Berlin Night.

The rapid increase of disruption in the food tech space attracted $6.8B in VC funding worldwide during 2015 ($2.3B within the US). Given the number of these startups launching in New York, Metro AG (Europe's 4th largest retailer) is coming to NYC to explore global trends in the food tech and restaurant services space.


Three founders will present their startups followed by a panel discussion with Olaf Koch (CEO Metro AG) and Jenny Fielding (Techstars Managing Director). We are holding this event as part of "Berlin Night", a pre - DLD evening event that brings together the tech ecosystem of Berlin and New York - also showcasing some of the most interesting developments from Berlin. Food, drinks and DJ included!


Presenting Companies

BagIQ
Automates food tracking by passively collecting a digital record of each product purchased with retailer loyalty cards or online. BagIQ aggregates & analyzes these data steams to create food dashboards, illuminating the path to achieving personal health & nutrition goals. Groupraise (Techstars alumni)
GroupRaise is a marketplace & booking engine for large group reservations at restaurants where a % of the sales is donated back to a charitable cause.


Journy (Techstars alumni)
Journy is a tailor-made travel planning service that combines the human elements of a travel agent with technology and automation. Their highly personalized service starts at $15 per day of travel. Journy concierges also handle reservations, and recommendations come from top chefs, influencers, and local experts. Metro & Techstars will also announce the opening of applications for the second class of their hospitality and food tech accelerator program.

The METRO Accelerator powered by Techstars is a highly-selective mentorship program for digital and technology startups across the entire value chain of hospitality and food tech. Ten companies will win investment and gather in Berlin for 13 weeks to accelerate their company with unprecedented access to resources from the METRO and Techstars Network. More details are available HERE

results.description:
[This small event filled up in 30 minutes. We hope to expand the number of seats, so please RSVP for the waiting list. Once you RSVP for the waiting list, the meetup.com system will email you if you make it on to the regular RSVP list. Or you can check this page any time for the status of your RSVP.]

***Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:00pm or 8:00pm is perfectly great.) Everyone pays for their own dinner. ***

Angelica Kitchen. Opened in 1976, Angelica's is 100% vegan and 95% organic. If this restaurant is not technically the first vegan restaurant in New York City, it is at least the _spiritual_ mother of all NYC vegan restaurants.


From Angelica Kitchen's web site: "Since 1976 Angelica Kitchen, has been serving fresh, delicious food in an atmosphere where sustainable agriculture and responsible business practices are the main ingredients. This combination reflects our deep respect for the environment and our gratitude toward the dedicated people who produce our food. Angelica Kitchen is pure vegan - 100% plant based - and a minimum of 95% of all food used to prepare our menu has been grown organically. Maintaining committed, direct relationships with local farmers, food artisans, purveyors, and customers keeps our menu reasonably priced while ensuring the vitality of the ingredients. Ingredients used to prepare our menu are grown ecologically and fairly traded; we use renewable sources of energy and a high quality backwash carbon system to filter our water; our active composting assures as little waste as possible."

New York Magazine raves: "With its chic SoCal decor and warm bohemian ambience, Angelica Kitchen deserves its reputation as one of downtown's best date spots for vegetarians. It's been around for years now, but the menu continues to be consistently creative, attracting not only vegetarians but health-conscious diners of all stripes. The famous walnut-lentil pâté is as flavorful and richly textured as any meat variety; and desserts, despite the absence of eggs and refined sugars, are necessary indulgences here (definitely order them topped with maple-tofu whipped cream). Entrees ranging from salads, sandwiches, and Angelica's signature "dragon bowls" to nightly specials that often incorporate Asian and Latin American influences feature fresh, unusual organic produce along with the standard protein bases of tempeh and tofu. You could easily eat here dozens of times without getting bored—as the line outside the door would suggest."

Zagat: "A longtime vegan standard-bearer, this 'go-with-the-flow' East Village mainstay is a wholesome destination for 'your-body-as-a-temple' dining at a reasonable, cash-only cost; though the decor is spartan and the service loose, there’s always a line for a table; news flash: it now serves wine and beer."

Special Deal for Our Meetup Members: Angelica Kitchen is giving us a free appetizer with every entree. That's a great deal. Thank you, Angelica! (I ask that if you are not looking to come for an entree tonight but are only looking for a snack, please don't rsvp for this event. In that case it is best to go on your own and let someone who is looking to "get the deal" have your spot at this small meetup.)

Angelica Kitchen's website and menu.


For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. It will be easy to find our group: just walk to the back dining room. Everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!


Where to Meet: Go inside the restaurant. You can ask any member of the waitstaff where the "meetup" is. They will direct you to our tables.

Train Directions: Take the 4, 5, 6, N, Q or R to Union Square, or the L to First Avenue. Angelica Kitchen is at 300 East 12th Street, almost on the corner of 2nd Avenue, between 1st Ave. and 2nd Ave.


I am delighted that the renowned Angelica Kitchen is welcoming us for dinner. Hope to see you there.

David


***Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. (Arriving at 7:00pm or 8:00pm is perfectly great.) Everyone pays for their own dinner. ***

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting any new players.


INTRODUCTION:Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. The suddenly, they were tasked with ferrying one of these mysterious items and the courier carrying it to somewhere it would be safe.


They learned quickly that numerous were those with interest in what they possessed. Their mission was immediately fraught with danger and the party was running for its life. Then, just as quickly as it had started, it was over. The adventurers became separated from many in their group including Melrick, the wizard that had hired them to protect his journey.


They passed through an alien realm they soon became certain was the dark realm known as the Shadowfell. Their stay on the plane of shadow was short-lived, however, and they soon found themselves back in the natural world. But they were very far from home and a number of their comrades were not with them.


What will Robin, Meline, Trask, Poe, Zyle, and Malako do now? Do they try to reunite with their mates and finish their mission? If so, how will they go about finding them? These are questions they all ponder and one of their number does so along with the realization that they’ve arrived at his homeland. A homeland he had left nearly two decades prior swearing to only return when he had made his fortune.


BACKGROUND:

“In Pursuit of Power" is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the first and third Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Monday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. This game will run in parallel with the 

“Keeper of the Keys” game with my hope being both groups can meet for a massive gaming session every now and again.
results.name: In Pursuit of Power - An Azocar Adventure

results.description:
You are invited to join us for a data science study session. On Monday, May 2, we will have two presentations. Reina Kikuchi, data scientist for Recruit Lifestyle in Tokyo, will discuss optimizing restaurant reservations. Followed by Jeroen Soeters, senior developer for ThoughtWorks, who will present building artificial neural networks using neuroevolution.


Schedule

6:30 PM - 6:45 PM Settling in and introductions

6:45 PM - 7:15 PM Optimizing restaurant reservations by Reina

7:15 PM - 8:30 PM Neuroevolution presentation by Jeroen

8:30 PM - 9:00 PM Networking


Summary 1

It is important for a restaurant whether to accept or reject a reservation request to improve their revenue. An experienced manager knows which party they should accept and which not.  These days, online restaurant reservations are increasing. So, we need some algorithm to judge a request instead of a restaurant manager. My approach is to develop an algorithm which can determine the most efficient table configuration and acceptance of parties. The model is a mixture of Monte Carlo methods and combinatorial optimization. I will talk about how to formulate the problem and how to solve it. The simulated results show the best table configuration accepts 50% more customers than the worst one.


Summary 2

Neuroevolution is a subcategory of machine learning that applies evolutionary computation to generate artificial neural networks. Traditionally neural networks are trained using the backpropagation algorithm. Back propagation is limited in its application especially in scenarios where a training set of sufficient size is unavailable as in artificial life or evolutionary robotics. Backpropagation also puts a lot of constraints on the topology of the network. The number of hidden layers as well as the number of neurons per layer need to be known in advance, the activation function must be differentiable, the network must be fully connected and recurrent connections are not allowed. Neuroevolution provides an alternative approach which generates nets that don't suffer from these limitations and can evolve to any topology.

In this talk, I take you on a journey where we first explore the foundation of artificial neural networks and evolutionary computation. In the latter half you will learn how to combine the two and create a general-purpose platform for neural network based systems from cleaning robots to financial oracles. 

Biography 1

Reina Kikuchi is a data scientist for Recruit Lifestyle, the company that has 40+ services, like restaurant search and reservation service, hotel search service and salon search service in Japan. She is interested in making a profit by analyzing data. She is currently working on churn prediction and prevention, recommendation, restaurant yield management and so on.


Biography 2

Jeroen Soeters is a senior developer for ThoughtWorks. He works predominantly on distributed event-driven systems and micro services architectures. He is also a functional programming aficionado and co-organizer of FP AMS, the largest functional programming meetup in the Netherlands.
results.name: Data Science Study Session @Insight Data Science

results.description:
In this course, we will build an ASP.NET Core application from scratch. Along the way we will learn about middleware, controllers, views, and models. We'll support SQL Server using the Entity Framework and user registration with the Identity Framework. We'll also see novel techniques for working with front end frameworks like Bootstrap and JavaScript libraries like jQuery. By the end of the course, you'll have everything you need to start building applications with the ASP.NET Core framework.

About the Author: Scott has worked on everything from 8-bit embedded devices to large scale web sites during his 15+ years in commercial software development. Since 2001, Scott has focused on server-side and web technologies, like ASP.NET, ASP.NET AJAX, Windows Workflow, Silverlight, and LINQ. Scott is also a speaker at national conferences like VSLive!, as well as code camps and user groups near his hometown of Hagerstown, MD.

Scott has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP since 2005, and has written or co-authored several books on Microsoft technologies. Scott founded the site OdeToCode.com in 2004, and joined Pluralsight in 2007.
