results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the nuance and richness of connection, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, authentic relationships Ive seen become possible for them.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more I've seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, and grow in their natural presence and love for others.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $25 for one session or a bundle of 4 sessions for $80 that includes a one on one Circling conversation with the facilitator.

To ensure a full experience for everyone, the meetup will start promptly at 7:00. Please arrive no later then 6:55 to set up and be ready to begin.

Note: due to building security policies, attendees must RSVP 24 hours in advance (by Monday at 7:00PM), and must arrive at the event before 8:00PM on Tuesday.

Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Moat

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
This group meets on the first Tuesday of each month to view SF and other genre related films. Dining follows the movie.

This month's theme is anonymous.  The screenplay for I Married A Witch was by Dalton Trumbo - one of the most famously blacklisted Hollywood writers who often had to use an "anonymous" pseudonym.

Veronica Lake casts a seductive spell as a charmingly vengeful sorceress in this supernatural screwball classic. Many centuries after cursing the male descendants of the Salem puritan who sent her to the stake, this blonde bombshell with a broomstick finds herself drawn to one of them—a prospective governor (Fredric March) about to marry a spoiled socialite (Susan Hayward). The most delightful of the films the innovative French director René Clair made in Hollywood, I Married a Witch is a comic confection bursting with playful special effects and sparkling witticisms.  

Screenplay by Dalton Trumbo.  As one of the Hollywood Ten — a group of writers, producers and directors who refused to cooperate with the House Un-American Activities Committee's investigation into alleged communist influence in Hollywood, he'd been blacklisted from working at the major studios.  Still, many of the blacklisted writers such as Trumbo, who died in 1976, found a way to earn a living by writing under a pseudonym.  Even earning Oscar wins!
results.name: That's Science Fiction presents:  I Married A Witch (1942)

results.description:
Join us for an open-format discussion of effective altruism topics! If anyone would like to make announcements or propose a discussion topic feel free to do so.

For newcomers, read on:

If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategies, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk: 
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum, or read Will MacAskill's excellent book on the topic, Doing Good Better -- and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris

Please join us at our May General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots - Tuesday, May 3rd, at 7:00 PM.

Our May meeting will focus on Article V of the Constitution also known as the Convention of States.

Our government is out of control. Regulations, executive orders, taxation without representation, corrupt politicians, and out of control spending is only the tip of the iceberg of America's woes. What recourse do we have?

The Founders bequeathed to Americans a method to bypass the Federal Government bureaucracy, and to amend the Constitution by empowering two-thirds of the states to call an "Amendments Convention" in order to override those unconstitutional laws and mandates, and return the power and control to The People.

Don't miss our May meeting to learn more about what we can do to fix America before it's too late!

**************************************************************************

Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his personally hand picked "Videos of the Month".

**************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $90.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************


Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now.
 Thank You.

There are three 20 minute sitting meditation periods with two 10 min walking mediation periods in between.  You may only enter and exit the Zen Center during the walking meditation periods.  You may choose to sit for one period or for all three periods. This is a time for quieting the mind and refocusing on who you are.

Visit: Taegozencenter.com


General Schedule - (Entry times are firm  7:30pm, 8:00pm, 8:30pm )

7:30 - Start - Peroid 1

7:40 -Sitting Meditaiton

8:00 - Walking Meditation

8:00 - Start - Peroid 2

8:10 -Sitting Meditaiton

8:30 - Walking Meditation

8:30 - Start - Peroid 3

8:40 -Sitting Meditaiton

9:00 - End

results.description:
Please Join us on May 3rd

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

He will sit, offer daisan (one to one teaching) in the second period and a Dharma talk in the last period.

Please Join Us!

Questions or comments? Contact us at:
E-Mail: [masked]
website: whiteplainszen.org
<a>[masked]</a>

St. Bartholmew's Church
82 Prospect St.
White Plains, NY 10606

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description: Published just years before the French Revolution, Laclos's great novel of moral and emotional depravity is a disturbing and ultimately damning portrayal of a decadent society. Aristocrats and ex-lovers Marquise de Merteuil and Vicomte de Valmont embark on a sophisticated game of seduction and manipulation to bring amusement to their jaded lives. While Merteuil challenges Valmont to seduce an innocent convent girl, he is also occupied with the conquest of a virtuous married woman. Eventually their human pawns respond, and the consequences prove to be more serious-and deadly-than the players could have ever predicted.
results.name: Dangerous Liaisons by Pierre de LaClos

results.description:
Michael Rothschild is a pediatric otolaryngolgist in New York City and an avid scuba diver. He serves as a medical moderator for scubaboard.com, and has served as the dive chair and president of the NYC Sea Gypsies. He is also an award winning and published underwater photographer and videographer who lectures frequently on these topics.

While he certainly enjoys the warm, clear waters of the tropics, his passion for the underwater world has led him to explore and document the vibrant and diverse ecosystem right in his backyard, off the shores of New Jersey and Long Island, in a flooded quarry in Pennsylvania and in the St. Lawrence River on the Canadian border. By bringing images of this world back to his non-diving friends and family, he is able to share his love for underwater ecosystems with those who may never see them firsthand.
His web site is: http://dive.rothschilddesign.com
results.name: North Jersey Group:  The Underwater World in Our Backyard

This is our Weekly Tuesday Folder's meeting at Argo Tea on University Place near Union Square!

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

You don't have to be a genius to participate in this Trivia Night! Come  out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round! We will rotate everyone to new teams after each round (unless you have a  team already)

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7:15pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stay and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.
results.name: Fun and Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night at The Firehouse Tavern: FREE EVENT

results.description:
Host 4 This Meetup: Noel

Join Us For $2 Tuesdays At Wallington Lanes!

Bowling is always a fun activity no matter your age. The AMF Wallington Lanes is a huge bowling alley that has a bar and a concession stand to order food. They play some good upbeat music as your bowling. They also added a game area with basketball shooting, racing arcade games, and pool tables.

You only pay $2 for bowling shoes, $2 per game, and $2 for Pabst Blue Ribbon Draft Beer.

Expect To Pay About $7 As We'll Play 2 Games Per Person Plus The Shoe Cost.

2 Games x $2= $4 Plus Tax

Bowling Shoes= $2 Plus Tax

Any food or drinks you want to order will be at your expense. If your interested in just coming out to watch and not play, that's ok to. The bowling alley is located on Paterson Plank Road in Wallington NJ. It's brightly colored in Red & Black paint on the exterior of the building.

We'll meet by the bar and table area. Look for a meetup sign. Please arrive by 7:30pm so we can start shortly after.
results.how_to_find_us: MEET BY THE BAR & TABLE AREA. LOOK 4 MEETUP SIGN.
results.name: AMF Wallington Lanes $2 Tuesday Bowling Night! Food, Drinks, Free Parking!

results.description:
Come relax and receive.

Come experience the amazing healing power of Pranic Energy!

All you need to do it relax and receive. You will be guided into a deep meditative state where you will experience the power of meditation and your own mind! Here you will receive the deep, intelligent, healing & nourishing Energy Of Prana.

Prana is the intelligent life force energy in and around everything. It is the energy that creates galaxies and keeps them spinning. The energy which directs the growth of an embryo and the flourishing of a Forrest. It is the energy that keeps us alive, healthy & vital. When mastered through practices like Tai Chi, Qi Gong, Yoga, and Pranic Breathing, Prana can be cultivated, stored, directed and utilized in daily life. When received through another Pranic Being during deep relaxation it can wash over your entire being like a cleansing rainstorm washing away toxins, accumulations, pains, tensions and limiting patterns creating space for deep healing, nourishing and transformation. Even if it sounds mystical to you, I assure you it is simply the most natural and intelligent process in the world! Come discovery the ease with which you can heal and transform if you only show up and allow it!

Let love in

See you there!
results.name: Prana Energy Group Healing

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try.

And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.


The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!


Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*



There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!


****All are welcome to attend!****

results.description:
The Salsa On2, also known as New York style, is a fun Latin mix of various dance styles that start with Salsa On2 and include a little bit of Bachata, Merengue and Cha-Cha.

At Sol Dance Center we teach Salsa On2 in group or private classes. To further accommodate students of all levels, we offer 4 different classes: beginners, advanced-beginners, intermediate and performance.

Sometimes referred to as Mambo, the New York style Salsa On2 dominates the Mambo and Salsa competitions, although those styles are gaining respect as well. Our classes focus on musicality, shines (open fancy footwork away from your partner), leading and following, step patterns, partnering skills and on increasing the fun of social dancing.

You do not need a partner to join the classes. Students rotate partners, improving their ability to adapt to different levels of dancing style and experience. It also develops the dancers’ leading/following skills.

Our Salsa On2 group classes are 2 hours long. The first hour consists of shines and the second hour focuses on dynamic turn patterns for all levels (beginner, intermediate or advanced). The classes teach leading/following techniques, improved partners’ connection, styling tips for men and women, Salsa timing and spinning. The classes also develop your own individual style on the dance floor.

The Salsa On2 is mid-to-up-tempo salsa, with an emphasis on percussion and band orchestration rather than on vocals. It differs slightly from traditional salsa, known as Salsa On1, mainly by its timing which emphasizes the conga drums beat and encourages the dancer to listen to percussive elements of the music. It tends to place a greater emphasis on performing “shines”, where dancers separate and dance solo for a time.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Get out of here!!!  Mental and physical fatigue causes stress, sloppy decision making and carelessness.  Recharging your batteries will make you feel 100% better and a better employee.  Listen as Donald Palomino, President of Palomino Dream Vacations, speaks about going away to exotic far away destinations.  Some people just don't know when to take a break.  They work day and night, thinking that they can't afford or don't deserve to take a vacation.  Mr. Palomino will explain where the current bargains are and why a vacation is important to your health.  Studies have found that three days after a vacation, subjects' physical complaints, their quality of sleep and mood had improved as compared to before vacation.  Spending time enjoying life with loved ones can keep relationships strong, helping you enjoy the good times more and helping you through the stress of the hard times. 


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on May 4th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
AODC Mission Statement:

Open data is new name given to a timeless concept: it is information accessible by anyone. Open data is a growing global resource with potential to grow business, improve quality of government service, and increase innovation in healthcare, education, transportation, agriculture, gender equality. The Africa Open Data Community is a convening space for tech industry, small businesses, journalists, civic tech, entrepreneurs, researchers, students, IT solution providers, banks, telcoms, insurance companies, NGO's, donor organizations, and local and national governments to connect virtually and in person to share advances in open data, share lessons, and form new collaborations.  We seek a transparent, open dialogue and concrete action on common challenges and shared solutions for communities and partners across Africa.


Open data can generate jobs, build business confidence, make government more transparent, and revitalize communities.


• Open data from satellites can inventory agricultural production, help farmers improve yields, and improve financial results.

• Open data about transportation networks can improve freight delivery, tourism, and public safety.  

• Open health data can help consumers understand the capacities, costs, and potential outcomes of healthcare in their communities.

• And open climate data can help nations prepare for climate change and improve social and economic adaptation.

• Journalists can use open data to reveal new patterns of social, economic, and scientific discovery to tell new stories and help communities understand their world.

• Private Industry can publish open data and engage with civic leaders to empower women and transform conditions that are good for business and society.


Data is a tool to achieve the goals that matter to people, business, and government.  Working with this tool requires new skills and old common sense. AODC events provide both and engage people, civil society, journalists, and the private sector in a public dialog about the power of open data to transform our communities, governments, and businesses.  All of us can lead, partner, and work together to collect, publish, and share open data resources to drive sustainable development.


Africa must diversify its economies, increase economic participation, and empower women  - and data is an untapped resource that can generate tremendous economic opportunity. It can open up trade, improve agricultural production, reduce hunger and poverty, make service delivery more efficient, empower women, and help us all prepare for climate change.

AODC: Open Sustainable Development Data Day

At the edges of the regional gathering of Open Government Partnership, AODC will host a day event to share government and organizational experiences in developing and institutionalizing open data policies, will tackle a few of the Sustainable Development Goals including water and agriculture to determine how open data can be most useful in achieving the targets, and highlight the untapped leadership role of the private sector in sourcing and using quality open data for Africa.  This event is for journalists, civic technologists, IT solution providers, banks, telecommunications companies, insurance companies, NGO's, and local and national governments to roll up their sleeves and collaborate in workshops and interactive discussions.


In 2015, more than 190 world leaders committed to 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to help us all end extreme poverty, fight inequality and injustice, and fix climate change. We each have a role to play if we’re going to achieve these goals of a more prosperous, equitable, and sustainable world.  In this event, we are focusing on the role of open data in advancing two of the global Sustainable Development Goals:


SDG 5: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls

Gender inequalities are still deeply rooted in every society. Many women lack access to employment opportunities, basic education, and health care, and are often subjected to violence and discrimination. The math is simple: in countries where there's higher gender equality, there's less poverty, more economic growth, and a higher standard of living. Investing in women-run businesses produces the greatest return for growth and stability in other sectors within local communities and banking institutions are repaid loans in full at an average 97% far higher than the mean.  Let's improve opportunities for everyone by dismantling barriers to women's participation in economic, social and political life.


SDG 13: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

The world's industrialised nations have changed the balance of the earth's carbon cycle over the last 150 years by burning large amounts of fossil fuels. Climate change has the potential to derail other efforts toward sustainable development by altering weather patterns that threaten our food production and increasing sea levels which will displace coastal communities. Extreme weather threatens livelihoods and lives of people across the globe and across the continent Africa is undergoing a severe water crisis.  We need to increase awareness of the causes of and grow solutions that combat and adapt to climate crisis for individuals and world leaders before it is too late.


SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions

In the age of global connectivity, the ability to grow industry and improve livelihoods is dependent on the quality, accuracy, and speed of information.  Open government institutions working with well-trained storytellers and journalists can improve the dissemination of knowledge needed to spur innovation and growth from advancements in public transportation and road infrastructure to ensuring city and rural health centers are well stocked with supplies.  The rise of “infomediaries” ensures that the needs of people and clients are well understood and shared and that services that industry and government provide are reaching the intended destination.  Using improved data can greatly increase the efficiency and effectiveness of governments and supports stronger institutions that serve us all.

results.description:
A $10,000 prize is at stake in Montclair State's version of "Shark Tank," where teams of student entrepreneurs will compete to determine who has the best pitch for their product/service innovation.

The third annual TeleBrands Inventors Day for Aspiring Entrepreneurs will crown one student team the winner of bragging rights, and the $10,000 prize. Don't miss this day of anticipation and excitement, while cheering for our student teams.

Because of the growing interest in our entrepreneurship classes, the competition will be divided into two parts on May 4: a preliminary round with more than a dozen teams followed by the finalists' pitches. 

A pizza lunch will be served between the two rounds of pitches. The event is free and open to the public. All are welcome to come for any part of the day.

Agenda:
9:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. Preliminary round pitches judged by Rachel Braun Scherl, co-founder at SPARK Solutions for Growth; Krishnamurty Kambhampati, serial entrepreneur; Andrew Kangpan, associate at ff Venture Capital; Mukesh Patel, co-founder at JuiceTank. 
12:30 - 2 p.m. Pizza lunch, awarding of Entrepreneurship Certificates, Promise Prize presentation
2 - 4:00 p.m. Final round of pitches with Master of Ceremonies Anthony "Sully" Sullivan, the OxiClean TV Pitchman and judges AJ Khubani, CEO and founder of TeleBrands; Andrew R. Gatto, principal of Andrew R. Gatto Consulting; Marjorie Perry, president & CEO of MZM Construction & Management Co.

Watch a recap of last year's contest:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xEDDvPFS7lE

The TeleBrands Inventors Day for Aspiring Entrepreneurs is the culmination of two semesters of work in which Montclair State students created business models and marketing plans for their products/services, as well as hypothetical models for obtaining capital funding, all in conjunction with volunteer mentors. The students are pursuing a Certificate of Entrepreneurship, issued by the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship in the Feliciano School of Business at Montclair State University. The students have lived a true entrepreneurial experience during the school year, experiencing the hard work as well as frustrations they will face on the long road to launching a successful business. Seed capital for each team was funded by Guy Falzarano, founder and CEO of Lightbridge Academy. 


Directions and parking info: Park in the Red Hawk Deck on campus, exit the deck on Level 5 and proceed straight up the walkway (soccer field will be on your left). At the new Feliciano School of Business building, turn right and go up the outdoor staircase. University Hall will be straight ahead once you reach the top of the steps. Campus map with directions. (Please note the map in that link is old--the tennis courts shown on the map is where the Feliciano School of Business building now stands.)

Join the conversation on Twitter and Instagram: #MSUpitch and @FelicianoCenter

Come support these student entrepreneurs!
results.name: TeleBrands Inventors Day for Aspiring Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Collective Design engages a diverse range of global voices and expertise to create a compelling discourse on 20th and 21st century design. It is guided by a passionate group of industry leaders, including designers, architects, gallerists, and collectors, under the direction of its founder, architect Steven Learner. Active in the creative community throughout the year, Collective Design focuses its shared knowledge during its annual fair in New York City, which showcases the latest in design thinking and innovation.

The Collective Design fair is a commercial and educational platform featuring thoughtfully selected works from an international roster of established and emerging galleries. The fair has leveraged the city’s energy to become a vital part of New York’s cultural calendar, cultivating a spirit of discovery that appeals to both avid patrons and those new to collecting design.

Collective Design is dedicated to exploring the significance of design across creative disciplines and everyday life. Through its annual fair, Collective Design illuminates both the design process and the diversity of today’s material culture, originating a robust series of conversations and education programs to foster dialogue, encourage the exchange of ideas, and build a growing audience for collectible design.

http://collectivedesignfair.com
results.name: Collective Design Fair

Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

Step away from your day to quiet your mind and nourish your soul with a thirty-minute meditation experience.  

Learn simple Kundalini Yoga breathing techniques and meditations that reduce stress, increase your focus, balance your emotions  and magnify your presence.

Each session takes place in a chair and will  include: simple physical warm ups, breathing techniques, deep relaxation and meditation.

Feel refreshed and re-energized!  Beginners and experienced meditators welcome.  No change of clothes or yoga mat needed.

She enjoys sharing the benefits of yoga with new audiences and showing how it can be easily integrated into everyday life. Ms. London is an IKYTA certified Kundalini Yoga teacher as taught by Yogi Bhajan  and is a certified Lakshmi Chair yoga instructor.

This is the final session in a three-part series on the Wyckoff Method presented by Bruce Fraser and Roman Bogomazov, two nationally recognized experts who teach the Wyckoff Method of trading and investing at Golden Gate University in San Francisco. Previously they described basic market analytical and trading practices developed by legendary chartist and trader Richard D. Wyckoff, and illustrated in a detailed case study how these techniques can be applied using bar charts. On May 4th, they will discuss the critical role that Point and Figure (P&F) charts also play in the Wyckoff Method with respect to trade selection, timing and management. During this presentation, Bruce and Roman will demonstrate how to:

Construct a Wyckoff-style P&F chart;
Apply Wyckoff P&F count guidelines to estimate price targets and reward/risk ratios of potential trades;
Analyze phases on P&F charts to predict short- and longer-term price objectives;
Time entries to coincide with a stock's readiness to move out of a trading range;
Use "stepping stone" consolidations to confirm price targets and identify when a prior trend will resume; and
Combine P&F and bar chart analysis to refine trade entries and exits.

These applications of P&F charts are unique to the Wyckoff Method, and provide an exceptionally informative complement to bar chart analysis. Traders of all levels of skill and experience will benefit from and enjoy this presentation. About the Presenters

ROMAN BOGOMAZOV
Roman Bogomazov is an internationally recognized expert on the Wyckoff method of trading and investing. He is an Adjunct Professor at Golden Gate University (GGU), where he teaches the Wyckoff method as well as trading plan development, back-testing and trading performance. He is also a Principal with Wyckoff Associates, LLC, an enterprise dedicated to providing online Wyckoff method education to traders throughout the world. He provides consulting services to hedge fund managers and investment advisors on trading strategies and implementation, and also coaches individual and professional traders. His educational background includes a BS (Economics and Management) from the University of Maryland and an MS (Finance) as well as a certificate in Technical Market Analysis from GGU. He has been an active trader of stocks and futures for twenty years.

Roman has recently served as President of the Technical Securities Analysts Association San Francisco, and as a Board Member of the International Federation of Technical Analysts (IFTA).


BRUCE FRASER
Bruce Fraser has been teaching graduate courses in Technical Analysis at Golden Gate University since 1987. Along with Dr. Hank Pruden, he has developed curriculum for and taught many of the courses in the Technical Analysis Graduate Certificate Program including Technical Analysis of Securities, Strategy and Implementation, Business Cycle Analysis and the Wyckoff Method.

In 1990 Bruce and Dr. Pruden created the first graduate course devoted to the Wyckoff Method. The course has grown to a three semester series. Over the last 26 years many hundreds of students have taken these courses and the popular program has produced numerous legendary traders.

Bruce has been a devoted Wyckoffian for the past 35 years. In addition to using this as his primary Method for trading, he continues to enjoy team teaching the Wyckoff Courses with Dr. Pruden. He publishes a widely read and informative blog at StockCharts.com entitled 'Wyckoff Power Charting'.

Disclaimer:
Roman Bogomazov and Bruce Fraser ("Presenters") are not registered investment advisors or broker-dealers and do not purport to recommend or suggest which securities individuals should buy or sell. It should not be assumed that investments in securities, options, futures, ETFs, companies, sectors or any other markets identified and described were, are or will be profitable. You understand and acknowledge that there is an extremely high degree of financial risk and loss involved in trading securities of any kind. Presenters assume no responsibility or liability for your trading and investment results.
results.name: Analyzing and Trading Markets Using the Wyckoff Method - Part III

According to Forrester research "of the information buyers read before making a purchasing decision, 70% is online."

This statistic is a clear indicator that in 2016 your online brand is a vital piece of growing your business. Consumers, whether B2B or B2C, increasingly use the internet as the first step in researching products and services. Making sure your business can be found and expressing the right messaging online is crucial for converting new customers and for engaging current ones.

Register here: http://lp.vbout.com/creating-a-great-online-brand/

Online branding will have some similarities and many differences to your offline branding. We will discuss some of the key elements of successful online branding in this webinar.

YOU'LL LEARN ABOUT

1) The Three Pillars of Online Branding: Design, SEO and Engagement
2) Defining your strategy with a buyer persona
3) Key elements of online customer experience
4) Developing your online identity and voice
5) Strengthening your presence and reach

Register and get log-in details here:
http://lp.vbout.com/creating-a-great-online-brand/

results.description: Are you an entertainment professional working up front or behind the scenes in theatre, film, or the performing arts? Are you aware of the programs and services of The Actors Fund, which can not only help you in your career, but also in emergency situations should they arise? Join us for a special close-up conversation with Actors Fund President and C.E.O. Joseph P. Benincasa and other members of The Actors Fund team, and learn how this 134 year-old organization remains a staple in the entertainment community, and how their invaluable services for professionals in the arts may be just what you’re looking for in your artistic life and career. One need not be a member of entertainment unions and guilds, or a member of The Actors Fund in order to be assisted by this iconic organization, so seize the opportunity to attend this important discussion.

results.description:
Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 24 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

Also since this has come back up, we do not tolerate ground playing, overly physical play, and bad sportsmen-ship. You will be warned  twice and on the third, ejected. We are in this game for the fun and love of the sport. 

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.
results.name: Soccer meetup

results.description:
ALL ATTENDEES MUST REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE IN ORDER TO GAIN ACCESS TO THIS EVENT:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/playcrafting-nyc-spring-expo-tickets-23020174963

100 games. 700 players. 1 night. And pizza. 
Join us for our biggest Expo yet on May 4th at Microsoft! 

Over seventy game developers will be showing off their latest games one-on-one to a crowd of 700 people. For developers, this is a great opportunity to show off their games (finished or unfinished) and get direct feedback from players. For everyone else, it's a unique opportunity to try out the biggest collection of games made in and around NYC all in one place. Each game gets its own booth as players meet the developers and try out their games. Throw pizza into the mix and you get Playcrafting's biggest event! 

Playcrafting NYC Spring Expo!

Wednesday, May 4th  / 5:30-8:30pm
Microsoft (11 Times Square)
RSVP HERE

Visit Eventbrite for full details on this event and to secure a spot by purchasing a ticket.

Visit us at playcrafting.com for our full list of upcoming education and events!

Seats are limited. 

---

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

OP LOUNGE, THE OUT PROFESSIONALS NETWORKING SERIES, TAKES OVER ATTIC, HK’S BUZZY ROOFTOP HIDEAWAY.

On Wednesday, May 4, Out Professionals returns to Attic, Midtown West’s most glamorous hideaway. What’s more, this starry, over-the-top rooftop is all ours tonight for OP Lounge, the attitude-free networking series!

In his designs for Attic, Marc Dizon has drawn inspiration from Hollywood’s Golden Era. Drink in his bold, Beverly Hills patterns. Discover his invitingly plush, open-air seating.

There’s nothing like a rooftop to make connecting a breeze. That’s why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and dozens of our LGBT up-and-comers are so eager to network here tonight. Grab some business cards and add to the buzz!

WHERE

Attic, HK’s glamorous rooftop hideaway, at 251 West 48th Street (Eighth Avenue). Subway: 1/2/C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street.

WHAT’S UP

Rain-or-shine, outdoor-or-indoor networking and socializing from 6 to 9 p.m. Arrive early and enjoy Happy Hour prices until 7 p.m. — beer, $6; wine, $7; well drinks, $8.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, free. OP dues-payer at door, $5. Advance registration closes at noon on May 4. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

Enjoy a 12-month Individual OP Membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s event for just $65. And remember, this buys you a year of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing! Order here.

results.description:
Sally Henderson Memorial Lecture on Green Design


James Russell, the newly-appointed director of Design Strategic Initiatives at the NYC Department of Design and Construction, will speak about the agency’s recently released Guiding Principles for Design Excellence; upcoming initiatives in environmental sustainability, resiliency, equity, and healthy living; and the potential impact for interior spaces. Russell was the architecture critic for Bloomberg News, editor at Architectural Record, and has written for The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and The Economist. He is the author of The Agile City: Building Well-Being and Wealth in an Era of Climate Change.


The event is free & open to public. 

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: James Russell: Sustainability and Resiliency in NYC (NYSID Event)

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!


Please join us on Wednesday, May 4th for our monthly meetup at 30 Rock! 

You must enter your real name on the RSVP question or your RSVP will be removed. Check-in opens at 6pm sharp, see you on April 6th!


Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza sponsored by NBCUniversal
• 6:15 - Announcements
• 6:30 - Who's hiring, who's looking?
• 6:35 - Let the BoFs begin!
• 8:30 - Closing Remarks
• 8:45 - After party sponsored by Fastly @ Bill’s Bar & Burger (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

What is a BoF?

BoF stands for Birds of a feather. BoFs are informal discussions groups on specific topics. (See Wikipedia page on BoF)

We are hosting an 'Open BoF' meetup to get ourselves ready for DrupalCon New Orleans next week! We don't have presentations for this Meetup, but we still have people in the know who can help us, inspire us and spark new ideas on specific topics! Join us!

The room will be setup with round tables and power outlets in the tables so you should bring your computer to work on things you are interested in, we will have plenty of people around to help you install Drupal or go over the basics of Drupal and help troubleshoot issues you are having. 

BoF Topics 


==========

• New To Drupal

• Installing Drupal

• Media or Ad-supported sites

• Caching and D8

• Form API

• Entity system

• DevOps and Drupal Testing


• NYC Camp
results.how_to_find_us: Enter of 50th street entrance under the neon sign that says Rainbow Room/Observatory Deck. Then turn right & down the corridor on your left look for "NBC Guest Reception". You must bring your photo ID and your photo will be taken by security.
results.name: Drupal NYC 'Open BoF' Meetup @ 30 Rock - May 4th

results.description:
Event URL: http://www.sustainabilitypractice.net/events/giving-more-they-take-net-zero-nyc

RSVP [masked]


Topic:

 'Giving More Than They Take: Net Zero in NYC' 

Net Zero Energy and Net Positive buildings are the exemplars that will significantly reduce carbon emissions in New York City: buildings that give more than they take. Achieving Net Zero, however, is a tremendous challenge in a urban environment where density, shadows, and restricted roof area often limit PV, where a focus on first cost and short payback horizons limit the appetite to invest in a Low Carbon future, and where an aversion to risk can cause building owners and developers to get gun-shy or cause a contractor to triple their bid.

So how do we rise to the challenge?  Hear leading practitioners discuss their unique perspectives on the design, construction and financing of ultra high performance buildings. Team leads of highly touted projects such as Cornell Tech and PS 62 will discuss lessons learned, obstacles overcome, and their recommendations for how more architects, engineers, contractors, and developers will be able to make the impossible possible in the years to come.

Moderator: Max Driscoll, AIA, LEED AP BD+C;  Director Sustainable Development, SPN [business ecology]

Panelists: Deborah Moelis, AIA, Senior Associate, Handel Architects; Adrian Tuluca, Senior Principal, Vidaris; John Lee, Deputy Director, Green Buildings and Energy Efficiency, NYC Mayor’s Office of Sustainability; Robert DaRos, Vice President Sciame Construction
---

About the Sponsors:

The Sustainability Practice Network

 (SPN) is a New York based inter-disciplinary community of professionals who seek to learn and share knowledge to advance sustainable development across sectors and disciplines. We mobilize our members to practice sustainability in their lives and work. Our mission is to raise awareness of the importance of individual and corporate sustainability and thereby create a more stable and equitable world. 

Pratt Institute School of Architecture, Programs for Sustainable Planning and Development (PSPD)

 is an alliance of five urbanism programs with a shared value placed on urban sustainability and equity. The primary mission of the PSPD is to provide a professionally oriented education to a student body with diverse cultural and disciplinary backgrounds, and with diverse aspirations with regard to their careers and activism.
results.name: SPN/Pratt Symposium: Net Zero in NYC

results.description:
Water is a precious resource which we are especially reminded of in times of drought and water shortage. As we all depend on water for life, it is incumbent upon us to conserve water by utilizing it efficiently.


This meetup has two parts: The first part is a series of 3 talks on water related technologies. The second part is a hands-on lab with Arduino and appropriate sensors in which we’ll be able to prototype solutions to address issues with water and moisture detection.

DIY Water Turbidity meter (pictures): See below pictures for examples of devices that measure water turbidity (cloudiness of a fluid due to foreign particles, which is an instrumental test for water quality.)


We encourage anyone interested in this topic to attend the event, as there will be a mix of technical and non-technical people.

Speakers & Program Agenda

About Vlada Kenniff


Vlada is a Managing Director of the Demand Management and Resiliency group in the New York City Department of Environmental Protection. She manages a portfolio of sustainability and resiliency projects that cover a Water Demand Management Program, Climate Resiliency Program, and Green Infrastructure Projects. In the last five years with the agency, Vlada worked on the Sustainable Storm Water Management Plan, Managed the NYC Green Infrastructure Plan, and the Water Demand Management Plan.

About Ely Greenberg

Ely is an entrepreneur-in-residence at the Samsung Accelerator, where his team, Lotik Labs is developing clip-on water sensors to monitor water flow. These small devices clip on to toilets, sinks, showers, and other water consuming appliances in a home to increase water transparency and reduce water costs. Previously, he founded Erg Process Energy, a consulting company that provided full energy and data solutions to water and wastewater utilities. Before founding Erg Process Energy, he was a principal engineer at Hazen and Sawyer where he designed and managed a variety of wastewater treatment infrastructure projects. These included being the design services manager for construction of New York City's largest wastewater pump station and a member of the energy management team. Ely started in the water sector as a Peace Corps volunteer in Honduras. In 2014, he completed WEF's Water Leadership Institute.

About Stefania Druga

Stefania is currently leading the R&D efforts for Lotik Labs as part of the Samsung Accelerator and has also created the office’s digital fabrication lab. She is also a former Googler and graduated from an international Erasmus Mundus master of Media Engineering for Education (France, Spain, Portugal). In the summer of 2012 she was also the Education Teaching Fellow at Singularity University where she advised and coached 80 students from 36 countries. She is the founder of Hackidemia organization (mobile lab for Maker Education present in 40 countries), Afrimakers (community of Maker projects in 10 Africa countries) and MakerCamp (global camps for learning how to build and run makerspaces) Stefania is also an an ambassador for global MakerFaire in Berlin and Shenzhen, and mentor for NodeBots NYC, NYC Javascript.

To participate in this event there is a nominal $10 charge (through April 28) for the event. After April 28, the price will go up to $18.


Agenda

6:00pm  Networking

6:30pm  Welcome & Introduction
  Mitchell Golner, IoT Central
  Stefania Druga, Samsung Accelerator

6:40pm  “Global Water Challenges” 
Vlada Kenniff, Managing Director | Demand Management + Resiliency at New York City Department of Environmental Protection

6:50pm  “Point-of-Use” Water Monitoring Technology & its Impact
Ely Greenberg, CTO, Lotik

7:00pm   <TBA>

7:15pm    IoT & Water Lab
We will group into teams of 5 people each and be given a challenge relating to water usage measurement. Each group will be given Arduino (or similar) hardware and relevant sensors to use at the event.

8:15pm    IoT & Water Lab Demos
Teams will present their findings and demo their IoT & Water creations.

8:30pm   Member Announcements

8:35pm   Networking

9:00pm   End of event

results.description:
The Coming Out Series is an initiative to facilitate open conversations on hot button topics affecting the LGBT community in NYC and beyond including HIV/PrEP, mental health, religion and political beliefs.

The first in the Coming Out series will focus on the effectiveness of HIV preventative medication, how to access it and any possible side effects.

Gawker's Rich Juzwiak will moderate the conversation featuring viewpoint's from Andrew Goodman, MD, AAHIVS, Associate Director of Medicine at Callen-Lorde, Anthony Freeman, MA, Director of Monitoring, Education and Support for The LGBT Center and James Krellenstein of The Treatment Action Group.

Beer, wine and light refreshments will be served.

Please join us and be a part of this discussion. Please register for free at http://comingoutprep.eventbrite.com/
results.name: Coming Out: PrEP & HIV

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience!  It will also be full of great music from the 80's! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-80's Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: Amazing 80's Happy Hour and After Work Party ~ Free Event

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
As we imagine it, networking is an exotic activity which is practiced by extremely extroverted sales people, not something we would willingly do.  And if networking is something you like, how focused are you on the different approaches needed for each type? 

The fact is that most of us do not understand networking.  Networking is not one thing.  There are three distinct types of networking and none of them involve having a personality transplant to be successful.  Join coach Win Sheffield and learn how to use networking fully in a way that is effective for you and what you need in your career.
results.name: The Three Kinds of Networking and How to Master Them

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
